original: de ltar smra ba nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa nyid kyis mtho ris dang byang grol thob par byed pa'i lam nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir smra rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar smra ba nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa nyid kyis mtho ris dang byang grol thob par byed pa'i lam nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir smra rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the listeners, solitary realizers, and bodhisattvas are called speakers because they teach the unmistaken dependent origination and thereby reveal the path to attaining the higher realms and liberation.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni mtshog ces bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni mtshog ces bya ste /
translated: The word â€œsupremeâ€ means â€œbest.â€

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad smos pa dang ldan pa bstan pa /
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad smos pa dang ldan pa bstan pa /
translated: The perfect Buddha, who has taught dependent origination as it is described here, with the characteristics of being free from cessation, free from arising, and so on,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ni smra ba nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dam pa mchog yin te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ni smra ba nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dam pa mchog yin te /
translated: is the supreme, the best of all speakers, including the listeners, solitary realizers, and bodhisattvas.

original: de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: We pay homage to him.

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re /
translated: Here, others say:

original: gal te nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa nyid kyis mtho ris dang byang grol thob par byed pa'i lam nye bar ston par byed pa yin na /ğŸ”½'o na gang gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ston pa /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma log par ston par byed pa nyid kyis mtho ris dang byang grol thob par byed pa'i lam nye bar ston par byed pa yin na / 'o na gang gis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ston pa /
translated: If sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas also teach dependent origination without error, they would also teach the path that obtains high status and definite goodness.ğŸ”½If that is so, then how could the perfect Buddha be the best of all teachers,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' smra ba rnams kyi dam pa mchog tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pas /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' smra ba rnams kyi dam pa mchog tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pas /
translated: the best of all speakers, the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas?ğŸ”½In response to this objection, the Subcommentary states:

analyzed: ji ltar smos pa'i khyad par phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because he taught dependent origination endowed with the unerring distinctions mentioned.

analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i khyad par phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung @46a * // ba gang la sngar ji skad smos pa'i khyad par 'gag pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Dependent origination that possesses the unerring features mentioned above is called â€œdependent origination that possesses the unerring features mentioned above.â€ğŸ”½Dependent origination that possesses the unerring features mentioned above is dependent origination that possesses the unerring features mentioned above, such as the absence of cessation, the absence of arising, the absence of annihilation, the absence of permanence, the absence of coming, the absence of going, the absence of difference,

original: don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / spros pa nye bar zhi ba dang / zhi ba zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log pa dag yod pa de ni ji skad smos pa'i khyad par phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / spros pa nye bar zhi ba dang / zhi ba zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log pa dag yod pa de ni ji skad smos pa'i khyad par phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: the absence of sameness, the pacification of fabrication, and peace.

analyzed: de'i phyir de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /

original: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni 'dud par bya ba 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;ğŸ”½/'dir kha cig na re /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni 'dud par bya ba 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ; /'dir kha cig na re /
translated: This is the homage to him, the one who is to be bowed to.

analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung na ni ji ltar skye ba med pa yin /
translated: Here, someone might say, if it is dependent origination, how can it be nonarisen?

analyzed: de nyid kyis de'i don la skur pa btab pa'i phyir /

analyzed: ji ste skye ba med na ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung zhes byar yang mi rung bas rang gi tshig dang 'gal zhing dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs yin no // de la gal te /

analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung na ni //
translated: If it is dependently arisen,

original: 'di lta ste /ğŸ”½dbu ma pa khyod kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i @46b mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bstan pa de la 'dir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin la /

In that case, here in your statement, â€˜dependently arisenâ€™ is the basis for the distinction, and â€˜free from arisingâ€™ and so on are the distinctions.ğŸ”½Since you teach that dependent arising possesses the characteristics of being free from arising and so on, you contradict yourself.

analyzed: ji ste skye ba med na ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung zhes byar yang mi rung bas zhes bya ba yang de ltar dbu ma pa khyod kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bstan pa de la

original: dper na la la na re /

translated: For example, someone says,ğŸ”½â€œAll speech is false.â€

original: sgra'i nyes pas skyon 'dogs par byed pa dag de skad ces zer ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i nyes pas skyon 'dogs par byed pa dag de skad ces zer ba yin no //
translated: and you find fault with them by means of verbal tricks.

original: rgol ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pas /
analyzed: rgol ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pas /
translated: In response to that objection, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad skye ba med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de la gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad skye ba med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If you were to take the position that all dependent origination is nonarisen, then that would be a fault.

original: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir dang / don dam par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod par khas blangs nas /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir dang / don dam par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod par khas blangs nas /
translated: But since the word all includes the conventional dependent origination that you accept, and since you accept that ultimately dependent origination exists,

original: de la skur ba gdab par ma byas pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de la skur ba gdab par ma byas pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: and since you do not deny that, therefore your reason is not established.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba spang ba'i tshig nye bar dgod pa'i don de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba spang ba'i tshig nye bar dgod pa'i don de la'o //
translated: â€œIn that caseâ€ means â€œin that case, in order to avoid the fault of contradicting oneâ€™s own words, one should posit the meaning of the words.â€

original: 'di la sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi bden pa ni rnam pa gnyis te kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi bden pa ni rnam pa gnyis te kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Here, the Buddhists have two truths: conventional truth and ultimate truth.

original: @47b de la ji ltar kun rdzob tu rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @47b de la ji ltar kun rdzob tu rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show how this contradicts his own words conventionally, he says,

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thams cad skye ba med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thams cad skye ba med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: â€œIf one asserts that all dependently arisen phenomena are unarisen, then one would incur that error.â€

original: dbu ma pa smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: dbu ma pa smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye bar 'dod pas /
translated: The philosophical tenet of the Madhyamaka proponents is that all things are asserted to arise from their own specific causes and conditions conventionally.

original: 'dir gal te dbu ma pas kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye bar smra na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te dbu ma pas kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye bar smra na /
translated: Here, if the Madhyamaka proponents say that all things arise from their own specific causes and conditions conventionally,

original: de'i 'og tu bye brag med par dngos po thams cad kun rdzob tu skyed med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon der yang 'gyur pa zhig na ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bye brag med par dngos po thams cad kun rdzob tu skyed med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon der yang 'gyur pa zhig na ;
translated: If, after that, one were to make the assertion that all things in general are not produced conventionally, then one would incur the error of contradicting oneâ€™s own words.

original: de ltar dam 'cha' bar mi byed pas de'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon der yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar dam 'cha' bar mi byed pas de'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon der yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But since one does not make such an assertion, therefore one does not incur the error of contradicting oneâ€™s own words.

original: ji ltar skyon der mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar skyon der mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that one does not incur this error?

original: de'i phyir thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i khas blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i khas blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To answer this, he says, â€œbecause the term â€˜allâ€™ includes the acceptance of the dependent origination of the conventional.â€

original: sngar dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye'o zhes smras pa gang yin pa'i thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra des ni kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thams cad
analyzed: sngar dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye'o zhes smras pa gang yin pa'i thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra des ni kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thams cad
translated: Previously, it was said that all things arise from their own specific causes and conditions. Since the word all includes the acceptance of conventional dependent arising, it is not the case that one is making the promise that all dependent arisings

original: skye ba med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar mi byed pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes dam 'cha' bar mi byed pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon der mi 'gyur te /
translated: are nonarisen. Therefore one does not commit the error of contradicting oneâ€™s own words.

original: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi khongs su ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi khongs su ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase â€œit is not includedâ€ means that it is not included in the phrase â€œnonarisen.â€

original: don dam par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa /
analyzed: don dam par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa /
translated: The phrase â€œaccepting that ultimately dependent arisings existâ€

original: khas blangs nas de la skur ba gdab par ma byas pas zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: khas blangs nas de la skur ba gdab par ma byas pas zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: means that one does not repudiate them.

original: gal te don dam par dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye bar khas blangs nas /
analyzed: gal te don dam par dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye bar khas blangs nas /
translated: This is explained as follows. If one accepts that ultimately all things arise from their own specific causes and conditions,

original: yang don dam pa nyid du dngos po thams cad skye ba med do zhes de la skur pa gdab par byas sam /
analyzed: yang don dam pa nyid du dngos po thams cad skye ba med do zhes de la skur pa gdab par byas sam /
translated: Moreover, if you repudiate ultimate reality by saying that all things are non-arisen in the ultimate,

original: kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye bar khas blangs nas /ğŸ”½yang kun rdzob nyid du dngos po thams cad skye ba med do zhes de la skur pa gdab pa byas na ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na /ğŸ”½kho bos ni bden pa gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las khas blangs pa'i bden pa nyid la skye ba med pa de nyid khas blangs pa yang ma byas la /ğŸ”½bden pa gang la skye ba med pas khas blangs pa'i bden @48a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las skye bar khas blangs nas / yang kun rdzob nyid du dngos po thams cad skye ba med do zhes de la skur pa gdab pa byas na ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na / kho bos ni bden pa gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las khas blangs pa'i bden pa nyid la skye ba med pa de nyid khas blangs pa yang ma byas la / bden pa gang la skye ba med pas khas blangs pa'i bden @48a * //
translated: and you accept that all things arise from their own specific causes and conditions in the conventional,ğŸ”½and then you repudiate the conventional by saying that all things are non-arisen in the conventional, then you would incur the fault of contradicting your own words.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba khas blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir dang / don dam par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod par khas blangs nas de la skur ba gdab pa ma byas pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras kun rdzob pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba khas blangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir dang / don dam par yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod par khas blangs nas de la skur ba gdab pa ma byas pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.ğŸ”½This is because the word â€œallâ€ includes the relative dependent origination that is accepted, and because, having accepted that even ultimately there is dependent origination, you do not repudiate it.

original: khyod kyis kho bo la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon brjod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis kho bo la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon brjod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established, and you have committed the fallacy of contradicting your own assertion.

original: gnas brtan chos skyong gis kyang /
analyzed: gnas brtan chos skyong gis kyang /
translated: The elder DharmapÄla also says:

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byed pa brgya pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byed pa brgya pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
translated: â€œThe master Ä€ryadeva composed the Hundred Stanzas on the Middle Way, and in the commentary on that text,

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon 'di brjod de /
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon 'di brjod de /
translated: he states the fallacy of contradicting oneâ€™s own assertion.

original: dbu ma dang brgya pa ni lta ba mthun pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma dang brgya pa ni lta ba mthun pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since the Middle Way and the Hundred Stanzas agree on the view,

original: gnas brtan chos skyong gis kyang /
analyzed: gnas brtan chos skyong gis kyang /
translated: the elder DharmapÄla also says:

original: dbu ma pa'i bstan bcos kyi don mi shes bzhin du skyon btags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i bstan bcos kyi don mi shes bzhin du skyon btags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are faults imputed by those who do not understand the meaning of the treatises of the Middle Way.

original: dam bcas pa'i skyon de'i lan du lung 'thad pa dang bcas par sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i skyon de'i lan du lung 'thad pa dang bcas par sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove with a scripture that the fault of the thesis is not applicable,

original: dper na sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin yang 'khor bsdus pa las dge ba rnams zhes brjod pa dang / rnam par shes pa bdag tu khas blangs nas don dam par rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba lta bu dang zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin yang 'khor bsdus pa las dge ba rnams zhes brjod pa dang / rnam par shes pa bdag tu khas blangs nas don dam par rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba lta bu dang zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: he says, for example, just as generosity and so on are not ultimately virtuous, they are called virtuous from the perspective of attracting a retinue, and just as consciousness is accepted as the self, the thesis that ultimately consciousness is not the self does not incur the fault of a thesis.

original: de la dper na sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin yang 'khor sdud pa las dge ba rnams zhes brjod pa dang zhes bya bas ji skad bstan zhe na 'di la don dam par na dge ba ni thar pa gcig pu kho nar
analyzed: de la dper na sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin yang 'khor sdud pa las dge ba rnams zhes brjod pa dang zhes bya bas ji skad bstan zhe na 'di la don dam par na dge ba ni thar pa gcig pu kho nar
translated: Here, he says, for example, just as generosity and so on are not ultimately virtuous, they are called virtuous from the perspective of attracting a retinue. How is this taught? Here, ultimately, virtue is exhausted in just the one, liberation.

original: zad kyi gzhan ni cung zad med pas /
analyzed: zad kyi gzhan ni cung zad med pas /
translated: There is no other whatsoever.

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, generosity and so on are not ultimately virtuous.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag nga ni srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa chung ngu la yang mngon par dga' bar mi byed de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag nga ni srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa chung ngu la yang mngon par dga' bar mi byed de /
translated: The Blessed One said: â€œMonks, I do not delight in even the slightest production of existence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa ni chung ngu yang dri nga ba yin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni chung ngu yang dri nga ba yin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because even a little stench is a stench.â€

original: de lta bas na sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la sogs pa yon tan rnams ni don dam par dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la sogs pa yon tan rnams ni don dam par dge ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, wisdom, and so on are not ultimately virtuous.

original: 'on kyang 'khor ba sdud pa la ltos na dge ba rnams zhes kyang brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor ba sdud pa la ltos na dge ba rnams zhes kyang brjod de /
translated: However, in dependence on the accumulation of saá¹ƒsÄra, they are called virtues.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag @48b gus par byas te bsod nams dag bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag @48b gus par byas te bsod nams dag bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said: â€œMonks, you should create merit with respect.

original: gus par byas te bsod nams dag byas pa'i rnam par smin pa ni /
analyzed: gus par byas te bsod nams dag byas pa'i rnam par smin pa ni /
translated: The ripening of creating merit with respect is

original: 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is desirable, lovely, delightful, and attractive.

original: des na de ltar dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ltar dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the thesis does not arise in this way.

original: de la gal te sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin no zhes smras nas /
analyzed: de la gal te sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin no zhes smras nas /
translated: If you say that generosity and so on are not virtuous ultimately,

original: de dag don dam pa kho nar dge ba yang yin no zhes smras na ni de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag don dam pa kho nar dge ba yang yin no zhes smras na ni de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur la /
translated: and you say that they are virtuous only ultimately, then at that time the fault of the thesis arises.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu dge ba khas blangs nas de dag kun rdzob kho nar dge ba ma yin par yang khas blangs na ni de'i tshe yang dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu dge ba khas blangs nas de dag kun rdzob kho nar dge ba ma yin par yang khas blangs na ni de'i tshe yang dam bcas pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If you accept that generosity and so on are virtuous conventionally and you also accept that they are not virtuous only conventionally, then at that time the fault of the thesis also arises.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin yang 'khor ba sdud pa las dge ba rnams zhes brjod pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar 'dir yang dngos po rnams don dam par skye ba med pa yin yang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa don dam par dge ba ma yin yang 'khor ba sdud pa las dge ba rnams zhes brjod pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar 'dir yang dngos po rnams don dam par skye ba med pa yin yang /
translated: Just as it is not a fault to say that generosity and so on are virtuous even though they are not ultimately virtuous, but rather that they are virtuous in the sense of accumulating samsaric existence, in the same way, here too, even though things are ultimately not produced, they are said to be produced.

original: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as it is not a fault to assert that generosity and so on are virtuous even though they are not ultimately virtuous, but rather they are virtuous in the sense of gathering samsaric existence, in the same way, it is not a fault to assert that things are dependently arisen in the sense of arising from specific causes and conditions even though ultimately they do not arise.

original: rnam par shes pa bdag tu khas blangs nas don dam par rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba lta bu dang zhes bya bas ji skad bstan zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag tu khas blangs nas don dam par rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba lta bu dang zhes bya bas ji skad bstan zhe na /
translated: How does the phrase â€œjust as it is not a fault to assert that consciousness is not the self ultimately even though one asserts consciousness to be the selfâ€ illustrate this?

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'ga' zhig gis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'ga' zhig gis /
translated: Someone asked the BhagavÄn:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag ma mchis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag ma mchis na /
translated: â€œBhagavÄn, if there is no self,

original: ji ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dang 'bras bur 'brel par 'gyur zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dang 'bras bur 'brel par 'gyur zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The BhagavÄn replied:

original: sems dul ba ni dge ba ste //
analyzed: sems dul ba ni dge ba ste //
translated: A tamed mind is virtuous.

original: dul ba'i sems kyis bde ba bskyed //
analyzed: dul ba'i sems kyis bde ba bskyed //
translated: A tamed mind produces happiness.

original: ces bka' stsal pas /
analyzed: ces bka' stsal pas /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa la bdag dang bdag nyid du khas blangs nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa la bdag dang bdag nyid du khas blangs nas /
translated: Having conventionally accepted consciousness as the self and as having the nature of the self,

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i dus na rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i dus na rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin /
translated: when the truth of suffering and so on is seen, it is said, â€œConsciousness is not the self.

original: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: The self does not possess consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa la bdag med bdag la rnam par shes pa med do zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bdag med bdag la rnam par shes pa med do zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The self does not exist in consciousness, and consciousness does not exist in the self.â€

original: de ltar dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: de ltar dam bcas pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: Thus, just as the fault of contradiction does not arise in that assertion,

original: 'dir yang dngos po rnams don dam par skye ba med pa yin yang /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos po rnams don dam par skye ba med pa yin yang /
translated: here also, although things are ultimately unborn,

original: stan bcos 'di la ni 'gag pa dang skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don de dag thams cad bkag pas bzhed pa 'grub par dgongs pas de'i phyir tshig gi don de dag las gang kho na'i dgag pa smras pa de kho na rnam par

translated: But in this treatise, since it is the intention to establish the thesis by refuting all the meanings of the words, such as â€œcessationâ€ and â€œarising,â€ therefore, of all those meanings of the words, only the refutation of that which is stated is stated.

original: mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: That is the one that is consistent with nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de lta bas na snga phyi dgag pa'i rim pa dang tshig gi go rims nges par bya ba gang yin pa de skabs 'dir mi dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na snga phyi dgag pa'i rim pa dang tshig gi go rims nges par bya ba gang yin pa de skabs 'dir mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the sequence of earlier and later negations and the order of the words are not to be ascertained here.

original: de'i phyir don brtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don brtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œbecause the meaning is being investigated.â€

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni bstan bcos kyi don dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid brtag cing dpyad pa yin pa de'i ji ltar brda sprod pa la sgra dang sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzo'i mtshan nyid brtag cing dpyad pa lta bu mi dgos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni bstan bcos kyi don dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid brtag cing dpyad pa yin pa de'i ji ltar brda sprod pa la sgra dang sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzo'i mtshan nyid brtag cing dpyad pa lta bu mi dgos so //
translated: Since this treatise is an investigation and analysis of the nature of things, it is not necessary to investigate and analyze, as in grammar, the sounds and intrinsic identity of words and the identity of fabricated words.

original: tshig gzhan du byas na yang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dag khong nas mdo mdzad pa la nyes par smras pa nyid med pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: tshig gzhan du byas na yang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dag khong nas mdo mdzad pa la nyes par smras pa nyid med pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: The response, â€œThere is no fault because the consequence equally applies to other words,â€ is not only a response that the fault of the reason being unproven is not valid.

original: 'di ltar tshig gzhan du byas na yang brgal zhing brtag pa ha cang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig gzhan du byas na yang brgal zhing brtag pa ha cang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is also a response that the consequence of the absurd extension of the argument equally applies to other words.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: For example,

original: 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: cessation is not cessation,

original: zhes smras nas yang de'i tshe yang khyod na re /ğŸ”½ci'i phyir skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa zhes ma brjod ces rgol zhing rtog pa ha cang thal bar byed par 'gyur la /ğŸ”½gang gi tshe skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa zhes smras na yang de'i tshe khyod na re /
analyzed: zhes smras nas yang de'i tshe yang khyod na re / ci'i phyir skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa zhes ma brjod ces rgol zhing rtog pa ha cang thal bar byed par 'gyur la / gang gi tshe skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa zhes smras na yang de'i tshe khyod na re /
translated: Having said that, you again argue and think,ğŸ”½â€œWhy didnâ€™t you say â€˜non-arisingâ€™ and â€˜non-ceasingâ€™?â€ğŸ”½When you say â€œnon-arisingâ€ and â€œnon-ceasing,â€ you again argue,

original: ci'i phyir / 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: ci'i phyir / 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: â€œWhy didnâ€™t you say â€˜non-ceasingâ€™ and â€˜non-arisingâ€™?â€

original: zhes ma brjod ces rgol zhes rtog pa ha cang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir khyod kyi brgal zhing brtag pa'i tshig de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: zhes ma brjod ces rgol zhes rtog pa ha cang thal ba mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir khyod kyi brgal zhing brtag pa'i tshig de ni gyi na'o //
translated: Since the same absurd consequence of excessive application equally applies, your argument and investigation is nonsense.ğŸ”½The Autocommentary states, â€œThere is no error.â€

original: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pas lan gyi lam de dag gis nyes par brtags na /
analyzed: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pas lan gyi lam de dag gis nyes par brtags na /
translated: When the author of the commentary analyzes the error in those responses,

analyzed: slob dpon gyis mdzad pa'i skabs 'di la rgol ba gzhan dag gis smras pa'i nyes pa med do /ğŸ”½// / bam po drug pa /

original: bstan bcos 'dir 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi dngos po nyid 'gog par byed pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa dag gis kyang bstan bcos 'di mi bzod pas de'i phyir /

translated: Buddhists cannot accept it.

original: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig bstan bcos brtsam pa dgag par 'dod pa dag na re /ğŸ”½rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa @51a * //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig bstan bcos brtsam pa dgag par 'dod pa dag na re / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa @51a * //
translated: Therefore, some of our own Buddhist schools, who wish to refute the composition of this treatise, say:

original: ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir /

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas /

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /

original: 'dis ni bstan bcos 'dir 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi dngos po nyid 'gog par byed pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa dag gis kyang /
analyzed: 'dis ni bstan bcos 'dir 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi dngos po nyid 'gog par byed pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa dag gis kyang /
translated: Since this treatise refutes the reality of all conditioned phenomena, Buddhists cannot accept it.

analyzed: bstan bcos 'di ni bzod pas 'dir nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag de skad zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This treatise is called the â€œToleranceâ€ because the Sravakas of the Vaibhasika school say that it is so.

original: de la rang gi sde pa dag las zhes bya ba la /

translated: â€œFrom our own schoolsâ€ means

analyzed: sde zhes bya ba ni tshoms dang ris dang tshogs zhes bya ba dag dang don gcig go //

original: las zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word â€œfromâ€ is used in the sense of restriction.

original: rang gi sde pa dag kho na las yin gyi /

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag go //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag go //

original: bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni dbu ma zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos 'di'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni dbu ma zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos 'di'o //
translated: â€œTreatiseâ€ refers to this treatise called the â€œMiddle Wayâ€.

original: dgag par 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag dbu ma zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos 'di mi bya zhing dgag par 'dod pa de dag ni bstan bcos brtsam pa dgag par 'dod pa dag go //

analyzed: na re zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos brtsam pa dgag par 'dod pa de dag na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: They say na re is connected to those who wish to stop the composition of the treatise, meaning they say this.

original: khyad par gyi gzhi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gzhi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba /
translated: Endowed with the distinctions of dependent origination being unborn and so on is from the Perfection of Wisdom, where the basis of distinction is called dependent origination.

original: khyad par skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: khyad par skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa /
translated: In particular, it is endowed with the attributes of non-arising, non-cessation, non-annihilation, non-permanence, non-coming, non-going, non-difference, and non-sameness.

original: bstan bcos dbu ma zhes bya ba 'di'i lus su bzhag pa gang yin pa de'o //ğŸ”½'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang @51b ldan pa de khyed dbu ma pa na re /
analyzed: bstan bcos dbu ma zhes bya ba 'di'i lus su bzhag pa gang yin pa de'o // 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang @51b ldan pa de khyed dbu ma pa na re /
translated: This is the body of this treatise called the Middle Way.ğŸ”½Because it is unconditioned means that the dependent origination that arises from the perfection of wisdom, endowed with the attributes of non-arising and so forth, is said by you MÄdhyamikas to be unconditioned because it is not conditioned.

original: 'dus byas ma yin pas 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin no zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas ma yin pas 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin no zhes zer ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not shared in common with the hearers and so forth.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta na kho bo cag nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs la yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta na kho bo cag nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs la yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni
translated: if you think that way, then for us, the VaibhÄá¹£ika Å›rÄvakas, dependent origination that possesses the attributes of being unarisen and so on

original: 'dus ma byas nyid du yod par grub ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nyid du yod par grub ste /
translated: is established as existing as unconditioned.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang 'dus ma byas bzhi po dag ni rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang 'dus ma byas bzhi po dag ni rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because for us, the four types of unconditioned phenomena are asserted to be substantially existent.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: nam mkha' dang / so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags te 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / so sor ma brtags par 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags te 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid do //
translated: They are space, nonanalytical cessation, analytical cessation, and suchness.

original: kho bo cag gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'dus ma byas de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'dus ma byas de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are those unconditioned phenomena that possess the attributes of being dependent origination that is unarisen and so on for us?

original: 'di ltar / de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang // rdul dang 'byung ba dran pa dang // zhes bya ba nas de ma thag tu dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang // rdul dang 'byung ba dran pa dang // zhes bya ba nas de ma thag tu dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dang /
translated: the stage of peak, the stage of acceptance, the stage of the supreme mundane state,ğŸ”½the acceptance of the knowledge of the dharmas, the knowledge of the dharmas, the acceptance of subsequent knowledge, and subsequent knowledge.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shis pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug gi rim gyis /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shis pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug gi rim gyis /
translated: Through the stages of these sixteen moments of mind,

original: slob pa thams cad kyi mthar rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa dang ; mi skye pa shes pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa 'di ni kho bo cag gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'dus ma byas yin no //
analyzed: slob pa thams cad kyi mthar rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa dang ; mi skye pa shes pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa 'di ni kho bo cag gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'dus ma byas yin no //
translated: the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements and the knowledge of their nonarising arise in the vajra like concentration at the end of all the stages of learning. This is our unconditioned dependent origination that possesses the attributes of nonarising and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya zhing /
translated: Why is it called dependent origination?

original: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas zhes kyang bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas zhes kyang bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called unconditioned?

original: 'di ltar de ni rgyu gcig nas ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rgyu gcig nas ;
translated: Because it is not generated by a causal process

original: gcig tu brgyud pas bskyed ba yin pa'i phyir ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: gcig tu brgyud pas bskyed ba yin pa'i phyir ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya la /
translated: that extends from one to another, it is called dependent origination.

original: de la mngon sum gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it does not have a direct cause, it is called unconditioned.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar bod ba gnam 'gro la //
analyzed: ji ltar bod ba gnam 'gro la //
translated: When a clod is thrown into the air,ğŸ”½it has a cause, the force of the hand,

original: lag pa'i rgyu ni yod pa dang // de nyid 'bab la rgyu med pas //ğŸ”½de la 'phen rgyu 'ba' zhig go//
analyzed: lag pa'i rgyu ni yod pa dang // de nyid 'bab la rgyu med pas // de la 'phen rgyu 'ba' zhig go//
translated: but when it falls, it has no cause.

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: In this case, it is propelled by a single cause.

original: dper na bong ba gnam du 'phangs pa la ni lag pa'i shugs kyi rgyu yod la /
analyzed: dper na bong ba gnam du 'phangs pa la ni lag pa'i shugs kyi rgyu yod la /
translated: For example, when a clod is thrown into the air, it has a cause, the force of the hand.

original: de nyid thur du 'bab pa la ni rgyu med pas /
analyzed: de nyid thur du 'bab pa la ni rgyu med pas /
translated: When it falls to the ground, it has no cause.

original: de la yar 'phen pa la ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yod kyi /
analyzed: de la yar 'phen pa la ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yod kyi /
translated: In this case, the upward propulsion has a direct cause,ğŸ”½but the downward fall has no cause.

original: phyir 'bab pa la ni rgyu med de de brgyud pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: phyir 'bab pa la ni rgyu med de de brgyud pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: Just as this is similar to arising from a causal process,

original: kho bo cag gi zad pa dang mi skye ba @52a * //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi zad pa dang mi skye ba @52a * //
translated: for us, cessation and nonarising

original: shes pa 'di la yang dang po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa brgyud pa'i rgyu yod pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: shes pa 'di la yang dang po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa brgyud pa'i rgyu yod pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes kyang bya la /
translated: This consciousness is also called dependent origination because it has a causal continuum, such as the meditation on foulness, etc.

original: mngon sum gyi rgyu med pas 'dus ma byas zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rgyu med pas 'dus ma byas zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called unconditioned because it has no direct cause.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas so //
translated: Therefore, since that unconditioned dependent origination that occurs in the perfection of wisdom and possesses the attributes of nonarising, etc., is established in our system,ğŸ”½dependent origination is not uncommon to the sravakas.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par
translated: This is because dependent origination that occurs in the perfection of wisdom and possesses the attributes of nonarising, etc.,

original: dang ldan pa 'dus ma byas pa gang yin pa de kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: dang ldan pa 'dus ma byas pa gang yin pa de kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since that which is unconditioned and endowed with those is also established in our own system,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: dependent origination is not something that is not shared in common with the Å›rÄvakas.

original: thun mong kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thun mong kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is shared in common, that is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam ba rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam ba rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore it is not reasonable to compose a treatiseğŸ”½.

original: de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, since dependent origination is not shared in common with the Å›rÄvakas,ğŸ”½it is not reasonable to compose this treatise called the Middle Way.

original: 'dir bstan bcos byed pas dbu ma zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos 'di brtsam pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan bcos brtsam pa 'di 'gog par byed pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos byed pas dbu ma zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos 'di brtsam pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan bcos brtsam pa 'di 'gog par byed pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the refutation of the composition of this treatise.

original: bstan bcos 'dir 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi dngos po nyid 'gog par byed pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'dir 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi dngos po nyid 'gog par byed pas /
translated: Since this treatise refutes the reality of all conditioned phenomena,

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa dag gis kyang bstan bcos 'di mi bzod pas /
translated: Therefore, even Buddhists cannot tolerate this treatise.

original: nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag de skad zer ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag de skad zer ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this is what the Å›rÄvaka VaibhÄá¹£ikas say.

original: de skad rgol ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pas /
analyzed: de skad rgol ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pas /
translated: In response to such objections, the author of the commentary states:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni dgag pa'i tshul gyis ston pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni dgag pa'i tshul gyis ston pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Since dependent origination endowed with the attributes of nonarising and so on is taught by the method of negation and since there is no inference that can teach the existence of unconditioned dependent origination, and so on.

original: 'dis ni sngar nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: 'dis ni sngar nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: This is because the Å›rÄvaka VaibhÄá¹£ikas previously said:

analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa la sogs pa khyad par dang ldan pa ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas /
translated: Since dependent origination endowed with the attributes of nonarising and so on is unconditioned, it is established in our system.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Dependent origination is not common to the sravakas.

original: zhes zer ba'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,ğŸ”½the dependent origination that occurs in the perfection of wisdom is unconditioned, and the dependent origination that is described in the tenets of the sravaka Vaibhasikas is conditioned.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel @52b par 'byung ba'i 'dus ma byas dang / nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba'i grub pa'i mtha' las smra ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas ni khyad par shin tu che ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pas de'i phyir bstan bcos 'di brtsams
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel @52b par 'byung ba'i 'dus ma byas dang / nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba'i grub pa'i mtha' las smra ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas ni khyad par shin tu che ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pas de'i phyir bstan bcos 'di brtsams
translated: Since there is a very great difference between them, dependent origination is not common to the sravakas.

original: pa ni mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: pa ni mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is not illogical to compose this treatise.

original: de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni dgag pa'i tshul gyis ston pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni dgag pa'i tshul gyis ston pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni /

translated: It is endowed with the special qualities of non-arising, non-ceasing, non-annihilation, non-permanence,

analyzed: 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa / bstan bcos dbu ma zhes bya ba 'di'i lus su bzhag pa gang yin pa ni /
translated: non-coming, non-going, non-difference, and non-sameness.

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis ston la /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis ston la /
translated: I have taught this in the manner of negation, using terms such as â€œnon-arisingâ€ and â€œnon-ceasing.â€

analyzed: khyod kyis skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de dngos po'i tshul du khas len pas khyad par shin tu che ba'i phyir /
translated: You, on the other hand, accept non-arising as a mode of being of things. The difference between us is vast.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pas de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam pa mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pas de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam pa mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since dependent origination is not shared in common with sravakas, it is not illogical to compose a treatise on it.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba khyed na re /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba khyed na re /
translated: If you sravakas who are Vaibhasikas say,

translated: dependent origination does not exist as a thing,ğŸ”½but it is taught to exist as unconditioned,

analyzed: 'on kyang de 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston na mi de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: then you have no inference to prove that.ğŸ”½If you sravakas who are Vaibhasikas say, dependent origination does not exist as a thing, but it is taught to exist as unconditioned, then you have no inference to prove that dependent origination is taught to exist as unconditioned.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni tshig tsam gyis gzhan la go bar byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni tshig tsam gyis gzhan la go bar byar mi rung ste /
translated: For it is not suitable to make others understand dependent origination through mere words.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dgos na rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na de yang khyod la med pa /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dgos na rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na de yang khyod la med pa /
translated: If you need the valid knowledge of inference, then you do not have the clarity and thatness of inference.

original: khyod sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na ni nga la yod pas khyad par shin tu che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyod sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na ni nga la yod pas khyad par shin tu che ba'i phyir /
translated: But I do have the clarity and thatness of the refutation, so there is a great difference.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pas de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam pa mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pas de'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam pa mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since dependent arising is not shared with the Å›rÄvakas, it is not the case that it is illogical to compose a treatise.

original: rkyen nges pa las skyes pa de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na zhes bya ba ni @53a * //
analyzed: rkyen nges pa las skyes pa de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na zhes bya ba ni @53a * //
translated: If you imagine that which arises from the ascertainment of conditions to be unconditioned,

original: 'grel pa byed pas /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas /
translated: the author of the commentary says:

original: nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a statement anticipating the qualm of the Å›rÄvaka VaibhÄá¹£ika.

original: sngar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na bstan pa dang / 'dir gal te nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na bstan pa dang / 'dir gal te nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, if the Å›rÄvaka VaibhÄá¹£ika demonstrates that dependent origination is an unconditioned existent, then the clear explanation and demonstration of that is not suitable.

original: rkyen nges pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: rkyen nges pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung bar ston to //
translated: If one conceives that arising from the ascertainment of conditions is itself unconditioned, that is also unsuitable.

original: de la rkyen nges pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rkyen nges pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, if one conceives that arising from the ascertainment of conditions is itself unconditioned,

original: rkyen nges pa las zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang / rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa dang / zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rkyen nges pa las zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang / rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa dang / zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ascertainment of conditions is as follows: thus, engaging in that is the meditation on repulsiveness, mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, and so on,

original: de ma thag tu /
analyzed: de ma thag tu /
translated: immediately after which,

original: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dang / zag pa med pa'i chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug gis rim gyis slob pa thams cad kyi mtha' rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de'i
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dang / zag pa med pa'i chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug gis rim gyis slob pa thams cad kyi mtha' rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de'i
translated: The sixteen moments of mind are the stage of heat, peak, patience, the supreme mundane state, the receptivity of the knowledge of the doctrine, the knowledge of the doctrine, the receptivity of subsequent knowledge, and subsequent knowledge.

original: rkyen dang po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa brgyud pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rkyen nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen dang po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa brgyud pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rkyen nges pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de las skye ba de zhes bya ba ni rkyen nges pa de las skye ba zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba de'o //
translated: The knowledge that arises from that is the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa de rkyen nges pa dang po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa brgyud pa'i rgyu las byung bar zad kyi //ğŸ”½de la mngon sum gyi rgyu bar du ma chod pa nyid med pas des na bral ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas te 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na'o //
analyzed: de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa de rkyen nges pa dang po mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa brgyud pa'i rgyu las byung bar zad kyi // de la mngon sum gyi rgyu bar du ma chod pa nyid med pas des na bral ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas te 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na'o //
translated: If one imagines that to be unconditioned,

original: de ltar rtog na de yang mi rung ste ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rtog na de yang mi rung ste ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
translated: then that is also unacceptable. Why is it unacceptable?

original: de'i phyir skye ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir de'i chos nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir de'i chos nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œbecause the nature of that is impossible due to the negation of arising.â€

original: skye ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi rkyen nges pa las skye ba zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba de kho bos don dam par bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi rkyen nges pa las skye ba zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba de kho bos don dam par bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of arising is just that, the arising of the knowledge that is the knowledge of elimination and nonarising from the causes of the condition of ascertainment, such as the meditation on foulness, etc.,ğŸ”½is just that which we have negated ultimately.

original: de'i chos nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba de'i @53b chos nyid 'dus ma byas nyid mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i chos nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba de'i @53b chos nyid 'dus ma byas nyid mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the unconditioned reality of that arising is impossible.

original: 'di ltar khyod kyi rkyen nges pa las skye ba zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shas pa skye ba de kho bos don dam par bkag pa nyid kyi phyir skye ba de'i chos nyid 'dus ma byas nyid kyang mi srid pas de'i phyir khyod rkyen nges
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyi rkyen nges pa las skye ba zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shas pa skye ba de kho bos don dam par bkag pa nyid kyi phyir skye ba de'i chos nyid 'dus ma byas nyid kyang mi srid pas de'i phyir khyod rkyen nges
translated: Thus, since we have refuted the arising of the cognition that knows the exhaustion of arising and nonarising due to the ascertainment of its conditions in the ultimate, the unconditioned reality of that arising is also impossible.

original: pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, if you imagine that arising due to the ascertainment of its conditions is unconditioned, that is also illogical.

original: de lta bas na khyod la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na med la /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyod la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba dang de kho na med la /
translated: Thus, when you demonstrate that unconditioned dependent origination exists, you have no evidence for inference and no reality.

original: kho bo la ni khyod kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang / de kho na yod pas de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pas bstan bcos brtsam pa mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo la ni khyod kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang / de kho na yod pas de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pas bstan bcos brtsam pa mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But for me, you have clarified the refutation of the unconditioned dependent origination that you teach to exist,ğŸ”½and because that reality exists, it is not unreasonable to compose a treatise that teaches dependent origination that is not shared with the Å›rÄvakas.

original: gzhan yang nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba'i rkyen nges pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog pa sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba'i rkyen nges pa las skye ba de 'dus ma byas nyid du rtog pa sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to clarify the refutation of the conception that the arising that is ascertained from conditions of the Å›rÄvaka VaibhÄá¹£ikas is itself unconditioned and to teach that reality,

original: skye ba ni 'dus ma byas pa yin te ;
analyzed: skye ba ni 'dus ma byas pa yin te ;
translated: he said, â€œArising is not unconditioned,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it possesses a cause, like endurance.â€

original: de la skye ba ni 'dus ma byas ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de la skye ba ni 'dus ma byas ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyogs yin te /
translated: Regarding that, â€œArising is not unconditionedâ€ is the thesis.

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba gad yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba gad yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that knows the exhaustion of past and future afflictions and their nonarising is not unconditioned.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos yin te /
translated: The reason â€œbecause it possesses a causeâ€ is a property of the subject.

original: ce'i phyir skye ba ni 'dus ma byas ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ce'i phyir skye ba ni 'dus ma byas ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is arising not unconditioned?

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it possesses a cause.

original: 'di ltar bye brag tu smra ba khyed kyis zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba de rkyen nges pa las skye'o zhes khas blangs pas de rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bye brag tu smra ba khyed kyis zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba de rkyen nges pa las skye'o zhes khas blangs pas de rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Because you Vaibhasikas assert that the cognition that knows the exhaustion of afflictions and their nonarising arises from the ascertainment of conditions, it possesses a cause and is not unconditioned.

original: gal te khyed 'di skad ces rkyen nges pa las skye ba zhes bya ba de ni de brgyud pa'i rgyu las skye bar smras pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te khyed 'di skad ces rkyen nges pa las skye ba zhes bya ba de ni de brgyud pa'i rgyu las skye bar smras pa yin gyi /
translated: If you say, â€œThe ascertainment of conditions is said to arise from the cause of that,â€

original: mngon sum gyi rgyu las skye bar ma smras pas de'i phyir dbu ma pa khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes kho bo la zer na /ğŸ”½de ltar na yang kho bo ni rgyu brgyud pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rgyu las skye bar ma smras pas de'i phyir dbu ma pa khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes kho bo la zer na / de ltar na yang kho bo ni rgyu brgyud pa'am /
translated: Since we do not say that it arises from a cause of direct perception, therefore your argument that â€œthe meaning of your reason is not establishedâ€ is not relevant to us.

original: mngon sum du smra bar 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum du smra bar 'dod pa ma yin gyi /

original: chos kyi spyi nyid bzung nas rjes su dpag par byed de /ğŸ”½rgyu brgyud pa'am /
analyzed: chos kyi spyi nyid bzung nas rjes su dpag par byed de / rgyu brgyud pa'am /
translated: We infer a general phenomenon, having apprehended it.

original: mngon sum gang yin pa de'i bye brag mi sems pas de'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gang yin pa de'i bye brag mi sems pas de'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not consider the specific type of cause, whether it is direct or indirect. Therefore the meaning of our reason is not not established.

original: gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin te /ğŸ”½skye ba rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma @54a * //
analyzed: gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin te / skye ba rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma @54a * //

original: byas ma yin par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: byas ma yin par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Since arising has a cause, how could it be unconditioned?

original: gnas pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gnas pa bzhin te /
translated: Like endurance.

original: dper na 'dus byas kyi chos gnas pa rnams kyang rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'dus byas kyi chos gnas pa rnams kyang rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, conditioned phenomena endure because they have a cause.

original: 'dus ma byas ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma yin pa bzhin du /

original: nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba de yang rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i shes pa skye ba de yang rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
translated: and the knowledge that the afflictions are exhausted and will not arise again is also not unconditioned because it arises with a cause.

original: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas ma yin pa nyid spang pa'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe rgyu med par smra ba nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas ma yin pa nyid spang pa'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe rgyu med par smra ba nyid du 'gyur zhing /

original: lung dang yang 'gal te /
analyzed: lung dang yang 'gal te /
translated: And that contradicts scripture.

original: 'di ltar lung las /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung las /
translated: Because a scripture declares:

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi dngos po ni rgyu med par mi skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi dngos po ni rgyu med par mi skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

original: rjes su dpag pa las de med pas mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las de med pas mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /

analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thun mong ba nyid ces bya ba de med pas /
translated: Thus, because the so-called common dependent origination does not exist for the Vaibhasikas of the ÅšrÄvakas from the perspective of inference,

analyzed: slob dpon gyis bstan bcos brtsam pa mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Master has not composed this treatise in order to refute the world, but rather to demonstrate the meaning of dependent origination as it is taught in the Perfection of Wisdom.

translated: It is special because it is endowed with the special attributes of non-arising, non-ceasing, non-annihilation, non-eternality, non-coming, non-going, non-identity, and non-difference.ğŸ”½Some Buddhists,

analyzed: 'gag pa med pa ni mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i 'gag pa med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gsung rab kyi tshul yin pa nyan thos dang thun mong ma @54b yin pa nyid ma yin te /

translated: Here, in this treatise, the perfection of wisdom teaches

analyzed: de las gzhan skye ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos te /

translated: A pot is produced from the assembly of causes and conditions such as clay, a stick, a wheel, string, water, and fire. A cloth is produced from the assembly of causes and conditions such as thread, a shuttle, a needle, a loom, and so on.
