translated: In the opponent's position, consciousness itself is renowned as existent in the relative. The probandum is the absence of self-arising.ğŸ”½Both the proponent and the opponent agree that the property of the probandum, absence of self-arising, is renowned as existent for both the proponent and the opponent. Since both of those exist, it is called the subject.

original: chos can shes pa yod pa nyid de la bdag las skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: chos can shes pa yod pa nyid de la bdag las skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: The subject is the existence of consciousness. The probandum is the absence of self-arising. The reason is because it exists.

original: 'dir yang chos can nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba 'di yang rgol ba'i phyogs la ni bdag gis byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa nyid ces bya bar yod pa nyid du grags la /
analyzed: 'dir yang chos can nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba 'di yang rgol ba'i phyogs la ni bdag gis byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa nyid ces bya bar yod pa nyid du grags la /
translated: In the same way, here the subject is the inner sense sources. For the proponent, they are renowned as existent in the sense that they are empowered and made into a basis by the self.

original: phyir rgol ba'i phyogs la ni kun rdzob tu yul 'dzin nus pa nyid ces bya bar yod pa nyid du grags pa /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i phyogs la ni kun rdzob tu yul 'dzin nus pa nyid ces bya bar yod pa nyid du grags pa /
translated: In the opponentâ€™s position, the capacity to apprehend objects is known as â€œexistenceâ€ in the conventional sense.ğŸ”½For example, it is like the fact that sound is known to exist as that which arises immediately upon the exertion of effort.

original: dper na sgra la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du yod pa nyid du grags pa dang 'dra ba de la bsgrub par bya ba chos bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dper na sgra la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du yod pa nyid du grags pa dang 'dra ba de la bsgrub par bya ba chos bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba /
translated: In that regard, the probandum is called â€œnot arising from itself.â€

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa dang / bdag las skye ba med pa de sgrub pa'i chos yod pa nyid ces bya ba rgol @68b ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa de gnyis yod pas de yang chos can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa dang / bdag las skye ba med pa de sgrub pa'i chos yod pa nyid ces bya ba rgol @68b ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa de gnyis yod pas de yang chos can zhes bya ste /
translated: That is known to both the proponent and the opponent. The property of the subject that proves that there is no arising from self is called â€œexistence.â€ That is known to both the proponent and the opponent. Since those two exist, that is called the subject.

original: chos can nang gi skye mched rnams la yang bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos can nang gi skye mched rnams la yang bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: It is ascertained that the internal sense sources, the subject, do not arise from themselves because they exist.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like the existence of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir gang dang gang yod pa de la skye ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dang gang yod pa de la skye ba med de /
translated: Therefore, whatever exists does not arise.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the existence of consciousness.

original: nang gi skye mched nyid rnams kyang yod pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir de dag la yang skye ba med do //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched nyid rnams kyang yod pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir de dag la yang skye ba med do //
translated: Since the internal sense spheres themselves exist, therefore they also do not arise.

original: gal te yod pa nyid du 'dra ba las nang gi skye mched rnams la ni skye ba yod par 'dod la /ğŸ”½shes pa yod pa nyid la ni skye ba med par 'dod na ni de'i tshe rgyu 'dis nang gi skye mched rnams la skye ba yod par 'dod la /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid du 'dra ba las nang gi skye mched rnams la ni skye ba yod par 'dod la / shes pa yod pa nyid la ni skye ba med par 'dod na ni de'i tshe rgyu 'dis nang gi skye mched rnams la skye ba yod par 'dod la /
translated: If you assert that the internal sense spheres have arising because they are similar in existing,ğŸ”½and you assert that the existence of consciousness has no arising, then at that time you must state a specific reason for distinguishing that this cause asserts the arising of the internal sense spheres,

original: rgyu 'di ni shes pa yod pa nyid la skye ba med par 'dod do zhes khyad par nyid du bya ba'i khyad par gyi gtan tshigs brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: rgyu 'di ni shes pa yod pa nyid la skye ba med par 'dod do zhes khyad par nyid du bya ba'i khyad par gyi gtan tshigs brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: and this cause asserts the non-arising of the existence of consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir bdag las skye bar smra ba dag la shes pa yod pa nyid yod pa'i gnas skabs la skye bar mi 'dod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag las skye bar smra ba dag la shes pa yod pa nyid yod pa'i gnas skabs la skye bar mi 'dod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because for those who propound arising from self, they do not assert arising in the state of the existence of consciousness.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams kyang bdag nyid yod pa las skye ba med par 'gyur po //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams kyang bdag nyid yod pa las skye ba med par 'gyur po //
translated: Therefore, the internal sense spheres also would not arise from their own existence.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi skye ba ci'i phyir 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi skye ba ci'i phyir 'dod ce na /
translated: Moreover, why do you assert that things arise?

original: bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir skye bar 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir skye bar 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If you assert that they arise in order to obtain their own intrinsic reality which has not been obtained,

original: gal te nang gi skye mched de dag la skye ba'i snga rol na bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na de dag las skye bar brtags pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gal te nang gi skye mched de dag la skye ba'i snga rol na bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na de dag las skye bar brtags pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: then if those internal bases already had their own intrinsic reality prior to arising, what use is it to imagine that they arise?

original: skyes pa la yang skye ba med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa la yang skye ba med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, â€œThat which has arisen does not arise again.â€

original: gzhan yang dgag pa mi mthun par yang 'gyur te /ğŸ”½gal te yod na ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgag pa mi mthun par yang 'gyur te / gal te yod na ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, the refutation would be inconsistent.ğŸ”½If it exists, it does not arise.

original: ci ste skye na ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste skye na ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it arises, it does not exist.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten na yod pa nyid skye ba ni 'gal te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten na yod pa nyid skye ba ni 'gal te ;
translated: Moreover, in the world, existence and arising are contradictory.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na bum pa sbrang rtsi dang chu dang 'o ma 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed nus pa gsal bar yod pa ni yang skye bar mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na bum pa sbrang rtsi dang chu dang 'o ma 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed nus pa gsal bar yod pa ni yang skye bar mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the world, a vase, for example, is clearly existent and able to perform the function of holding honey, water, milk, and so on, but it is not seen arising again.

original: don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad bdag las skye ba med par 'gag pa yin na ci'i phyir 'dir /
analyzed: don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad bdag las skye ba med par 'gag pa yin na ci'i phyir 'dir /
translated: In the ultimate truth, all outer and inner things are shown to be unproduced from themselves.ğŸ”½

original: nang gi skye mched rnams nyi tshe chos can du gzhag ce na /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams nyi tshe chos can du gzhag ce na /
translated: One may say: But if, in the ultimate, the arising of all outer and inner entities from self is refuted, why are only the inner sense sources here posited as the subject?

original: de ni / dngos po gcig la gang mthong ba //
analyzed: de ni / dngos po gcig la gang mthong ba //
translated: To this it is replied: What is seen in one thing

original: de ni kun la'ang mthong bar 'dod //
analyzed: de ni kun la'ang mthong bar 'dod //
translated: is held to be seen in all things.

original: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
translated: The emptiness of one thing

original: de nyid kun gyi stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de nyid kun gyi stong pa nyid //
translated: is the emptiness of all things.

original: ces gsungs pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i rigs pas /
translated: By this reasoning,

original: nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par grub na phyi rol gyi skye mched la @69a * //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par grub na phyi rol gyi skye mched la @69a * //
translated: if it is established that the inner sense sources do not arise from self, the outer sense sources

original: sogs pa chos thams cad kyang bdag las skye ba med pa nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir dang / nang gi skye mched rnams chos can du bzhag na phyi rol gyi skye mched la sogs pa gzhan dag gtan tshigs dang dper gzhag tu rung bas de'i phyir nang gi skye mched rnams nyi tshe chos can du gzhag go /ğŸ”½// / bam po brgyad pa //ğŸ”½gal te gtan tshigs yod pa nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sogs pa chos thams cad kyang bdag las skye ba med pa nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir dang / nang gi skye mched rnams chos can du bzhag na phyi rol gyi skye mched la sogs pa gzhan dag gtan tshigs dang dper gzhag tu rung bas de'i phyir nang gi skye mched rnams nyi tshe chos can du gzhag go / // / bam po brgyad pa // gal te gtan tshigs yod pa nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and so on, because all phenomena are established as not arising from self, and because when the internal sense bases are posited as the subject, other things such as the external sense bases are suitable to be posited as the reason and example. Therefore, only the internal sense bases are posited as the subject.

original: rtog ge pa dag 'grel pa byed pa la gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon gyis rgol ba'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog ge pa dag 'grel pa byed pa la gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon gyis rgol ba'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: If someone says, â€œThe existence of the reason is not a reason because it is not shown to be the opposite of the discordant class,â€ this is a question raised by logicians to the author of the commentary.

original: de la gal te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis rtog ge pa dag gi dogs ba bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis rtog ge pa dag gi dogs ba bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word â€œifâ€ is a statement by the author of the commentary that raises the question of the logicians.

original: gtan tshigs yod pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yod pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The existence of the reason is not a reasonğŸ”½because it is not shown to be the opposite of the discordant class.

original: 'grel pa byed pas sngar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med pa'i gtan tshigs su yod pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas sngar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med pa'i gtan tshigs su yod pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid do //
translated: The author of the commentary says, â€œThe reason â€˜because it existsâ€™ that was previously stated for the non-arising of the internal sense spheres from self is the same here.â€

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: â€œBecause the reversal from the discordant side has not been stated, it is not a reason.â€

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can gyi mi 'dra ba'i phyogs kyi tshig gi don mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can gyi mi 'dra ba'i phyogs kyi tshig gi don mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The â€œdiscordant sideâ€ is a term for the dissimilar side of the subject and predicate. The meaning of the term is the discordant side.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las ldog pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos gnyis med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las ldog pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos gnyis med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe reversal from that discordant sideâ€ means that the predicate of the probandum and the property of the probandum do not exist on the discordant side. This is called â€œthe reversal from the discordant side.â€

original: de ma bstan pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa de ma bstan ma bshad pas so //
analyzed: de ma bstan pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa de ma bstan ma bshad pas so //
translated: â€œBecause it has not been statedâ€ means that the reversal from the discordant side has not been stated or explained.

original: gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pas sngar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med pa'i gtan tshigs su yod pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pas sngar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med pa'i gtan tshigs su yod pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs nyid ma yin te /
translated: The Commentary states, â€œThe reason is not a reason.â€ The reason â€œbecause they existâ€ was previously explained as a reason that internal sense spheres do not arise from self. That reason is not a reason.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the reason â€œbecause they existâ€ is not ascertained, since it does not teach the opposite of the discordant class, it is not a reason.

original: de gtan tshigs nyid ma yin pas de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyang mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gtan tshigs nyid ma yin pas de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyang mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since that is not a reason, the property to be established is also not established.

original: de yang 'di ltar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The definition of a reason is as follows:

original: tshul gsum ldan pa'i rtags bstan pa //
analyzed: tshul gsum ldan pa'i rtags bstan pa //
translated: The indication of a reason possessing the three modes

original: phyogs kyi chos la gnas pa yin //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos la gnas pa yin //
translated: Rests on the property of the subject.

original: lhag ma tshul gnyis btags pa ni //
analyzed: lhag ma tshul gnyis btags pa ni //
translated: The two remaining modes are imputed

original: dpe yis rab tu bstan pa yin //
analyzed: dpe yis rab tu bstan pa yin //
translated: And are fully taught by the example.

original: zhes bya bas tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags bstan @69b pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags bstan @69b pa yin no //
translated: This shows the reason having the three modes.

original: de la tshul gsum ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang // mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul gsum ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang // mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: Therein, the three modes are: existing in the inferential object, existing in the similar class, and being ascertained as not existing in the dissimilar class.

original: tshul gsum po dag la rtags kyang gsum ste /
analyzed: tshul gsum po dag la rtags kyang gsum ste /
translated: There are also three reasons for the three modes:

original: mi dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / 'bras bu'o //
translated: non-observation, nature, and effect.

original: des rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyi rtags gsum ni /
analyzed: des rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyi rtags gsum ni /
translated: The three reasons for ascertaining the existence in the inferential object are:

original: mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag par bya ba la ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag par bya ba la ni /
translated: For the inference of non-existence from non-observation,

original: 'di na dngos po med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag par bya ba la ni sgra mi rtag pa ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag par bya ba la ni 'di la rgyu yod de 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di na dngos po med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag par bya ba la ni sgra mi rtag pa ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag par bya ba la ni 'di la rgyu yod de 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The evidence of effect that proves the existence of a cause is exemplified by the statement, â€œHere there is a cause because an effect is observed.â€

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyi rtags gsum ni /ğŸ”½mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe phyogs 'di na dngos po med de ;
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyi rtags gsum ni / mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe phyogs 'di na dngos po med de ;
translated: The three types of evidence that are ascertained to exist in similar instances are as follows:ğŸ”½The evidence of nonobservation that proves the nonexistence of something is exemplified by the statement, â€œHere there is no pot because a pot, which would be perceptible, is not observed.â€

original: dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe 'di ni shing yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe 'di ni shing yin te /
translated: The evidence of nature that proves impermanence is exemplified by the statement, â€œThis is a tree because it is an oak.â€

original: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe tshad mang 'di na me yod de du ba 'thul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe tshad mang 'di na me yod de du ba 'thul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: For example, This is a Å›imÅ›apÄ tree because it is a tree, and Here there is fire because there is smoke.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyi rtags gsum ni mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyi rtags gsum ni mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe /
translated: The three types of evidence that are ascertained to be nonexistent in the discordant side are the examples of the dissimilar class for inferring the nonexistence of a thing from nonapprehension.ğŸ”½For example, In this place, a thing exists because a pot, which is an object of apprehension, is apprehended, and In this place, a thing does not exist because a pot, which is an object of apprehension, is not apprehended.

original: phyogs 'di na dngos po yod de dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur pa'i bum pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe /
analyzed: phyogs 'di na dngos po yod de dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur pa'i bum pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe /
translated: The three types of evidence that are ascertained to be nonexistent in the similar class are the examples of the dissimilar class for inferring impermanence from essence and so on.ğŸ”½ For example, This sound is impermanent because it is produced, This sound is impermanent because it is a product, and This sound is impermanent because it is a thing.

original: nam mkha' rtag ste ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe /
analyzed: nam mkha' rtag ste ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe /
translated: The three types of evidence that are ascertained to be nonexistent in the similar class are the examples of the dissimilar class for inferring the cause from the effect and so on.ğŸ”½ For example, In this place, fire exists because there is smoke, In this place, fire does not exist because there is no smoke, and In this place, fire does not exist because there is no smoke.

original: khron pa 'di na me med de ba mo yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khron pa 'di na me med de ba mo yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, In this well, there is no fire because there is fog, and In this place, there is no fire because there is no smoke.ğŸ”½ For example, This sound is impermanent because it is produced, This sound is impermanent because it is a product, and This sound is impermanent because it is a thing.

original: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags kyis gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan dgos na /
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags kyis gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan dgos na /
translated: If the definition of a logical argument is to be taught by means of a reason that possesses the three modes,

original: 'dir nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir zhes bstan pas /
analyzed: 'dir nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir zhes bstan pas /
translated: then here, the inner sense sources are ascertained to not arise from themselves because they exist.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags kyang yod /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags kyang yod /
translated: Since this is taught, the reason also exists in the manner of being ascertained as existent in the object of inference.

original: @70a * // dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bstan pas mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags kyang yod na /
analyzed: @70a * // dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bstan pas mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags kyang yod na /
translated: Since it is taught, â€œFor example, it is like the existence of consciousness,â€ the reason also exists in the manner of being ascertained as existent in the concordant class.

original: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags ma bstan pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma tshang nas ;
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags ma bstan pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma tshang nas ;
translated: Since the reason is not taught in the manner of being ascertained as nonexistent in the discordant class, therefore the definition of a logical argument is incomplete.

original: gtan tshigs yod pa nyid ces bya ba de ma nges pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhes na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yod pa nyid ces bya ba de ma nges pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no zhes na /
translated: Since the reason â€œexistenceâ€ is not ascertained, it is not a logical argument.

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis med pa kho na'i phyir de la ldog pa med pas 'di dang thams cad la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis med pa kho na'i phyir de la ldog pa med pas 'di dang thams cad la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary himself says, â€œBecause there is no such thing, there is no contradistinction. Therefore, there is no fault in this or in any other case.â€

original: de la med pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la med pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa kho na'i phyir te /
translated: In that passage, â€œbecause there is no such thingâ€ means because there is no contradistinction.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag dbu ma pa la ni nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag dbu ma pa la ni nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, for us Madhyamikas, there is no such thing as a contradistinction, called â€œproduction from another,â€ to the nonproduction of the internal media from themselves.

original: de la ldog pa med pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos gnyis ldog pa med pas te /
analyzed: de la ldog pa med pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos gnyis ldog pa med pas te /
translated: â€œThere is no contradistinctionâ€ means that there is no contradistinction of the two, the probandum and the probans, to that nonexistence of the contradistinction.

original: gal te bdag las skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba yod na ni de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos de gnyis ldog cing med par 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i
analyzed: gal te bdag las skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba yod na ni de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos de gnyis ldog cing med par 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i
translated: If there were something called â€œarising from other,â€ which is the opposite of â€œarising from self,â€ then the two propertiesâ€”the property to be proven and the proving propertyâ€”would be mutually exclusive and would not occur together.

original: tshul gyis rtags kyang bstan du rung ba zhig na /
analyzed: tshul gyis rtags kyang bstan du rung ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore it would be possible to teach the reason in such a way that it is ascertained to be absent in the dissimilar instances.

original: kho bo cag la bdag las skye ba med pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba de med pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bo cag la bdag las skye ba med pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan las skye ba zhes bya ba de med pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: But for us, there is no such thing as â€œarising from other,â€ which is the opposite of â€œarising from self.â€

original: de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ldog pa med pas 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags bstan mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ldog pa med pas 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags bstan mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore the two propertiesâ€”the property to be proven and the proving propertyâ€”are not mutually exclusive. Thus it is not necessary to teach the reason in such a way that it is ascertained to be absent in the dissimilar instances.ğŸ”½This is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'di dang thams cad la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i tshig 'di la yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon gyi nyes pa med la /
analyzed: 'di dang thams cad la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i tshig 'di la yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon gyi nyes pa med la /
translated: The response to this is that there is no fault in any of this.

original: 'di 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do /
analyzed: 'di 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do /
translated: This is not the only fault.

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos 'di la 'og nas 'byung ba'i sgrub pa gzhan thams cad la yang nyes pa 'di med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos 'di la 'og nas 'byung ba'i sgrub pa gzhan thams cad la yang nyes pa 'di med do //
translated: In this way, all the other proofs that will be stated later in the treatise are also without fault.

original: 'di skad bstan te mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod na ni de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ldog pa yang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod na ni de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ldog pa yang bstan par bya ste /
translated: This is what is being said: If there is an opposing factor, then the probandum and the property of the probandum should be stated as absent in that.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' ni rtag ste ma byas pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @70b de gnyis ni ldog cing med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' ni rtag ste ma byas pa'i phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @70b de gnyis ni ldog cing med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: For example, in the case of â€œSound is impermanent because it is produced,â€ the opposing factor is permanence, and in that factor, which is unproduced, the probandum and the property of the probandum, â€œimpermanentâ€ and â€œproduced,â€ are absent.

original: smras pa / gang la mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid med pa de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ldog pa med do //
analyzed: smras pa / gang la mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid med pa de la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ldog pa med do //
translated: Objection: In that which is not an opposing factor, the probandum and the property of the probandum are not absent.

original: de'i phyir kho bo'i phyogs bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gzhan las skye ba zhes bya bar brtag grang na /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo'i phyogs bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gzhan las skye ba zhes bya bar brtag grang na /
translated: Therefore, in our position, if the counter-thesis of â€œnot arising from selfâ€ is taken to be â€œarising from another,â€

original: kho bos ni rnam pa thams cad kho na skye ba med par khas blangs pas de'i phyir kho bo la mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bos ni rnam pa thams cad kho na skye ba med par khas blangs pas de'i phyir kho bo la mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: then since we accept that all aspects are not arisen, therefore, since we have no counter-thesis,

original: de la ldog pa med pas gtan tshigs kyi skyon med do //
analyzed: de la ldog pa med pas gtan tshigs kyi skyon med do //
translated: there is no fault of the reason being nonestablished.

original: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma tshang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma tshang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is the reason incomplete.

original: 'di ltar kho bo la mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo la mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: Because we have no counter-thesis,

original: de la gtan tshigs rang bzhin gyis mi 'jug pa nyid ldog pa yang yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs rang bzhin gyis mi 'jug pa nyid ldog pa yang yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul gyis rtags kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: the reason is not nonestablished in the counter-thesis, and since the reason does not apply to the counter-thesis, it is also not contradictory.

original: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed do /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed do /
translated: Here, some SÄá¹ƒkhyas respond.

original: dam bcas pa 'di'i don gang yin /
analyzed: dam bcas pa 'di'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of this thesis?

original: ci bdag las zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
analyzed: ci bdag las zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
translated: What is the meaning of â€œfrom selfâ€?ğŸ”½Does it mean from the self of the effect?

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las /
translated: Or does it mean from the self of the cause?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the problem with these?

original: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las na ni grub pa la sgrub po //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las na ni grub pa la sgrub po //
translated: If it means from the self of the effect, then that which is already established would be established.

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las na ni 'gal ba'i don nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las na ni 'gal ba'i don nyid de /
translated: If it means from the self of the cause, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because all that arises arises only from the self of the cause.

original: 'dir de ltar gtan tshigs kyi skyon bsal ba la grangs can dag las 'bras bu dang rgyu dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid smra ba kha cig dngos po rnams kyi skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir de ltar gtan tshigs kyi skyon bsal ba la grangs can dag las 'bras bu dang rgyu dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid smra ba kha cig dngos po rnams kyi skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to eliminate the fault of the reason, some SÄá¹ƒkhyas, who advocate that effects, causes, and both are real, in order to prove that things arise,

original: slob dpon gyi dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med par sgrub pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon brjod pa'i rnam pas phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med par sgrub pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon brjod pa'i rnam pas phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed pa yin no //
translated: remain as opponents by stating the fault of the thesis that the master has proven that things do not arise from themselves.

original: de la 'dir zhes bya ba ni de ltar gtan tshigs kyi skon bsal ba'i skabs 'dir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir zhes bya ba ni de ltar gtan tshigs kyi skon bsal ba'i skabs 'dir ro //
translated: Here means in this context of the refutation of the reason.

original: grangs can dag las zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag las gyes pa nyi shu rtsa lnga yod do zhes grags pa de dag las so //
analyzed: grangs can dag las zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag las gyes pa nyi shu rtsa lnga yod do zhes grags pa de dag las so //
translated: From the Samkhyas means from the twenty-five divisions of the Samkhyas.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni de dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu dang gnyi ga smra ba gang dag dag yin pa kha cig go //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni de dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu dang gnyi ga smra ba gang dag dag yin pa kha cig go //
translated: Some means some of them, those who are proponents of cause, effect, and both.

original: phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni de dag dngos po rnams kyi skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni de dag dngos po rnams kyi skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: They object means that in order to prove the production of things,

original: slob dpon gyis dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med par sgrub pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon brjod pa'i rnam pas phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med par sgrub pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon brjod pa'i rnam pas phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: they remain as opponents by way of stating the faults of the thesis that the Acarya posits in order to prove that things are not produced from themselves.ğŸ”½What is the meaning of this thesis?

original: dam bcas pa 'di'i don gang yin zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med do zhes dam bcas pa de @71a * //
analyzed: dam bcas pa 'di'i don gang yin zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med do zhes dam bcas pa de @71a * //
translated: The Madhyamika's thesis is that things are not produced from themselves.

original: la bdag las zhes bya ba 'di'i don gang yin zhes klan ka tshol ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: la bdag las zhes bya ba 'di'i don gang yin zhes klan ka tshol ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The phrase from itself is a question that seeks to find fault.

original: ci bdag las zhes bya ba zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: ci bdag las zhes bya ba zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The phrase from itself indicates the following.

original: 'di la dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: All things have two aspects of reality:

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the reality of the effect and the reality of the cause.

original: de la 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni 'bras bu gsal ba'i tshul gyis yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni 'bras bu gsal ba'i tshul gyis yod pa'o //
translated: The reality of the effect is the existence of the effect in the manner of manifestation.

original: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid ni 'bras bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid yod pa kho na las skye bar mthong ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid ni 'bras bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid yod pa kho na las skye bar mthong ba ste /
translated: The reality of the cause is the existence of the cause that possesses the power to produce the effect.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i nus pa med pa'i rgyu las skye na ni 'bras kyi sa bon las kyang nas kyi myu gu skye ba'i rigs na mi skye bas de'i phyir rgyu gang las 'bras bu gang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa de rgyu de las skyes pas /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i nus pa med pa'i rgyu las skye na ni 'bras kyi sa bon las kyang nas kyi myu gu skye ba'i rigs na mi skye bas de'i phyir rgyu gang las 'bras bu gang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa de rgyu de las skyes pas /
translated: If the effect were to arise from a cause that does not possess the power to produce the effect, then it would be logical for a barley sprout to arise from a rice seed, but it does not. Therefore, because the effect arises only from a cause that possesses the power to produce the effect, the effect exists in the cause.

original: kho bos dngos po rnams bdag las skye'o zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni bdag rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pas skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: kho bos dngos po rnams bdag las skye'o zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni bdag rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pas skyes pa yin na /
translated: The statement â€œThings arise from themselvesâ€ is made by those who assert that things arise from themselves.

original: khyed kyi nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med do zhes dam bcas pa'i bdag las zhes bya ba de gang yin zhes gleng ba yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med do zhes dam bcas pa'i bdag las zhes bya ba de gang yin zhes gleng ba yin no //
translated: But in your assertion that the internal sense spheres do not arise from themselves, what is the meaning of â€œfrom themselvesâ€?

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba med pa yin nam zhes 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba med pa yin nam zhes 'dri ba yin no //
translated: â€œFrom the nature of the effectâ€ means â€œfrom the nature of the effect that exists as the essence of the manifest.â€

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa las skye ba med pa yin zhes gal gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa las skye ba med pa yin zhes gal gzung ba yin no //
translated: â€œFrom the nature of the causeâ€ means â€œfrom the nature of the cause that exists as the essence of the potential of the effect.â€

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the point of this?

original: phyogs de gnyi ga yang skyon chags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs de gnyi ga yang skyon chags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Both of these positions are flawed.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las na ni grub pa la sgrub po zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las na ni grub pa la sgrub po zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If it is from a self that is the effect, then it is said that the proof is of what is already established.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las na ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba med pa zhes bsgrub na ni'o //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las na ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba med pa zhes bsgrub na ni'o //
translated: If it is from a self that is the effect, then if you prove that it does not arise from a self that is the effect, that is, from a manifest entity that is the effect,

original: grub pa la sgrub po zhes bya ba ni de ltar na khyod kyi gtan tshigs de grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub po zhes bya ba ni de ltar na khyod kyi gtan tshigs de grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: then the proof is of what is already established. That is, in that case your reason would be the fault of proving what is already established.

original: 'di ltar 'di na mig la sogs pa skye mched yul 'dzin na nus pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa dag la yang skye ba med pa ni 'jig rten thams cad la grub zin pa yin pas de las skye ba med par bsgrub na ni grubğŸ”½pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na mig la sogs pa skye mched yul 'dzin na nus pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa dag la yang skye ba med pa ni 'jig rten thams cad la grub zin pa yin pas de las skye ba med par bsgrub na ni grubğŸ”½pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in this regard, the nonarising of the eyes and so on, which are the sense sources that have the capacity to apprehend objects, from a manifest entity that is the effect is already established for the entire world. Therefore, if you prove that they do not arise from that, then the proof is of what is already established.

original: de ltar na khyed nang gi skye mched yul 'dzin nus pa 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba med par bsgrub pa'i tshig de ni dper na smyon pa'am gdon gyis zin pa dag bum pa byas zin pa @71b yang bya'o
analyzed: de ltar na khyed nang gi skye mched yul 'dzin nus pa 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba med par bsgrub pa'i tshig de ni dper na smyon pa'am gdon gyis zin pa dag bum pa byas zin pa @71b yang bya'o
translated: In that case, your statement that â€œit is not produced from itself, which is the essence of the effect that is the capacity to apprehend the internal sense basesâ€ is just like the statement of a madman or someone possessed by a demon who says, â€œMake the pot again, even though it has already been made.â€

original: zhes zer ba'i tshig bzhin du grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i tshig bzhin du grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a statement that commits the error of proving what is already established.

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las na ni 'gal ba'i don de nyid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las na ni 'gal ba'i don de nyid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: But if it is from the nature of the cause, then that is the meaning of contradiction.

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las na ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid yod pa las skye ba med pa zhes bsgrub na ni'o //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las na ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid yod pa las skye ba med pa zhes bsgrub na ni'o //
translated: But if it is from the nature of the cause means if you prove that â€œit is not produced from the nature of the cause that exists and possesses the potency of the effect.â€

original: 'gal ba'i don nyid de zhes bya ba ni de ltar na khyed kyi gtan tshigs de 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don nyid de zhes bya ba ni de ltar na khyed kyi gtan tshigs de 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: Then that is the meaning of contradiction means in that case your reason commits the error of contradiction.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'bras bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu mer mer po la sogs pa bdag nyid yod pa las 'bras bu nang gi skye mched rnams gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du skye bar grags pa las 'bras bu skye ba med par sgrub na ni
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na 'bras bu'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu mer mer po la sogs pa bdag nyid yod pa las 'bras bu nang gi skye mched rnams gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du skye bar grags pa las 'bras bu skye ba med par sgrub na ni
translated: Thus, if you prove that the effect does not arise from the cause that is renowned in the world to possess the power to produce the effect, such as the sprout from the seed,

original: 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i don nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i don nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would be proving that which is already established for us.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because all that arises arises only from that which possesses the nature of the cause.

original: skye ba can thams cad ces bya ba ni dngos po gang la skye ba yod pa de ni skye ba can te nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched thams cad do //
analyzed: skye ba can thams cad ces bya ba ni dngos po gang la skye ba yod pa de ni skye ba can te nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched thams cad do //
translated: All that arises refers to any entity that arises. That which arises is all internal and external bases.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba can de dag thams cad ni 'bras bu'i nus pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye bar 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba can de dag thams cad ni 'bras bu'i nus pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye bar 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is renowned in the world that all things that arise arise only from the cause that is their own nature, the nature of the effect.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten nang gi skye mched thams cad kyang mer mer po la sogs pa rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye bar mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten nang gi skye mched thams cad kyang mer mer po la sogs pa rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye bar mthong la /
translated: For example, all internal sense bases are seen to arise from the cause that is their own nature, such as the embryonic stage of kalala and so on.

original: myu gu yang sa bon gyi bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba dang / bum pa yang 'jim pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gu yang sa bon gyi bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba dang / bum pa yang 'jim pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A sprout is seen to arise only from the nature of the seed, and a pot is seen to arise only from the nature of clay.

original: de lta bas na gal te rgyu'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba med par sgrub na ni 'jig rten na dngos po skye ba can thams cad rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye bar grags pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: de lta bas na gal te rgyu'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba med par sgrub na ni 'jig rten na dngos po skye ba can thams cad rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye bar grags pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro
translated: Thus, if you prove that things are not produced from a self-existence that exists in the cause, then you contradict the worldâ€™s well-known fact that all things that are produced arise only from a self-existence that exists in the cause.

original: zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir de ltar gtan tshigs kyi skyon bsal ba la /
analyzed: zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dir de ltar gtan tshigs kyi skyon bsal ba la /
translated: â€œ If you sayâ€ is the response to the above, in which the fault of the reason is cleared away.

original: grangs can dag las 'bras bu dang rgyu dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid smra ba kha cig dngos po rnams kyi skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs can dag las 'bras bu dang rgyu dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid smra ba kha cig dngos po rnams kyi skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Some SÄá¹ƒkhya proponents of the thesis that effects, causes, and both are real, in order to prove the production of things,

analyzed: slob dpon gyis dngos po rnams kyi skye ba bdag las skye ba med par bsgrub pa la dam bcas pa'i skyon brjod pa'i rnam pas phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas pa dag de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: say that the masterâ€™s proof that the production of things is not production from self is a statement of the fault of the thesis.

original: de skad zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary says,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te bdag @72a * //
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te bdag @72a * //
translated: â€œThat is not good, because self-existence

original: las skye ba tsam dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las skye ba tsam dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it refutes mere arising from self.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid las na yang bdag dang gzhan du gyur pa las kyang skye ba sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid las na yang bdag dang gzhan du gyur pa las kyang skye ba sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And from the point of view of the identity of the cause, it refutes arising from self and from other.

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: And because the existence of consciousness is accepted as having the characteristic of potentiality, there is no fault.

original: de la de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun dbyung ba'i rnam pa gnyi ga yang sun dbyung ba ltar snang ba yin pas bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de la de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun dbyung ba'i rnam pa gnyi ga yang sun dbyung ba ltar snang ba yin pas bzang po ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, it is not good because both forms of refutation are like refutations that are not refutations.

original: 'di ltar grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i don nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i don nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not an establishment of what has already been established and because it is not a meaning that is contradictory.

original: ji ltar na grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not an establishment of what has already been established?

original: de'i phyir bdag las skye ba tsam 'gag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag las skye ba tsam 'gag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, â€œbecause it refutes mere arising from self.â€

original: 'di la grub pa la sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga'i blo mthun pa'i don la yang gtan tshigs gzhan gyis sgrub pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di la grub pa la sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga'i blo mthun pa'i don la yang gtan tshigs gzhan gyis sgrub pa yin na /
translated: Here, â€œto establish what is already establishedâ€ means that if one establishes a meaning that is agreeable to both parties in a debate through reasoning,

analyzed: kho bos ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yod pa la skye ba med do zhes ma smras te / 'di ltar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
translated: then I do not say that arising exists in the nature of the effect.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid las zhes bye brag tu brjod pa ma byas pa kho nar bdag las skyes pa tsam kho nar 'gog par byed la /ğŸ”½khyod kyis ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid las zhes bye brag tu brjod pa ma byas pa kho nar bdag las skyes pa tsam kho nar 'gog par byed la / khyod kyis ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid las sam /
translated: Because I do not make any distinction, such as â€œfrom the nature of the effectâ€ or â€œfrom the nature of the cause,â€ I refute mere arising from self alone.

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las zhes bye brag tu brjod pa byas pas des na 'u bu cag blo mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid las zhes bye brag tu brjod pa byas pas des na 'u bu cag blo mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But you make a distinction, such as â€œfrom the nature of the effectâ€ or â€œfrom the nature of the cause.â€ Therefore, since we do not agree,

analyzed: kho bos dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med par bkag pa 'di grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: my refutation that things do not arise from self is not an establishment of what is already established.

original: ji ltar na 'gal ba'i don nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'gal ba'i don nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not a meaning that is contradictory?

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid las na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid las na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Even from the nature of the cause.

original: dngos po rnams rgyu'i bdag nyid las skye ba med par bsgrub na yang 'jig rten las grags pa dang 'gal ba'i don nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rgyu'i bdag nyid las skye ba med par bsgrub na yang 'jig rten las grags pa dang 'gal ba'i don nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you prove that things do not arise from the nature of the cause, then the meaning of the statement is not contradicted by what is familiar in the world.

original: 'di ltar khyod na re /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod na re /
translated: In this way, you say,ğŸ”½â€œBecause all things that arise arise only from the nature of the cause.â€

original: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba gang yin pa de 'dir brtag gi nyon cig //
analyzed: skye ba can thams cad ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba gang yin pa de 'dir brtag gi nyon cig //
translated: Consider this:

analyzed: ci myu gu'i rgyu'i sa bon zhes bya ba de myu gu'i rang gi bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: Is the cause of the sprout, the seed, the sproutâ€™s own nature?

original: 'on te bdag nyid gzhan yin /
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid gzhan yin /
translated: Or is it a different nature?

original: gang yang rung ba zhig tu brtag grang na /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig tu brtag grang na /
translated: You may think of it as either.

original: de la kho bo ni bdag dang gzhan du gyur pa las kyang skye ba sel ba'i phyir 'gal ba'i don nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la kho bo ni bdag dang gzhan du gyur pa las kyang skye ba sel ba'i phyir 'gal ba'i don nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In response to that, we say that because we refute arising from self and from another, the meaning of the statement is not contradicted by what is familiar in the world.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gal te myu gu'i rgyu'i sa bon de rang gi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te myu gu'i rgyu'i sa bon de rang gi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: If the seed, the cause of the sprout, is the sproutâ€™s own nature,

original: sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu yin na ni de'i phyir bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de legs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu yin na ni de'i phyir bdag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de legs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the seed itself is the sprout, then it is well said that â€œthere is no arising from self.â€ğŸ”½But if the seed is different from the sprout by way of its own entity, then later, in the context of demonstrating that things do not arise from other, you should say, â€œWait a minute!â€

original: ci ste myu gu'i @72b ngo bo nyid las sa bon bdag nyid gzhan yin na ni de'i phyir 'og kho na nas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med par ston pa'i skabs su brtag gi / cung zad sdod cig / de ltar gtan tshigs kyi skyon bsal
analyzed: ci ste myu gu'i @72b ngo bo nyid las sa bon bdag nyid gzhan yin na ni de'i phyir 'og kho na nas dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med par ston pa'i skabs su brtag gi / cung zad sdod cig / de ltar gtan tshigs kyi skyon bsal
translated: In this way, having cleared away the faults of the reason,

original: ba / 'dir grangs can dag kho na las nus pa smra ba gzhan kha cig dpe la skyon 'dogs par byed pa dag na re ;
analyzed: ba / 'dir grangs can dag kho na las nus pa smra ba gzhan kha cig dpe la skyon 'dogs par byed pa dag na re ;
translated: now some Enumerators who are proponents of potency, who are other than the ones above, who are fault-finders in regard to the example, say,

analyzed: khyed kyis sngar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: â€œPreviously you said, â€˜The internal sense sources are ascertained not to arise from self because they exist.ğŸ”½For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.â€™

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes sbyor ba'i tshig smras pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes sbyor ba'i tshig smras pa'i skabs su /

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The existence of consciousness is the essence of the person,

original: dper na dro ba ni me'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na dro ba ni me'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: just as heat is the essence of fire.

original: de yang dus thams cad du med de 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang dus thams cad du med de 'di ltar /
translated: Moreover, it does not exist at all times, because

original: blo yis don ni gnas byas pa //
analyzed: blo yis don ni gnas byas pa //
translated: the mind makes the object present.

original: skyes bus sems par byed pa yin //
analyzed: skyes bus sems par byed pa yin //
translated: The person thinks.

original: zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas /
translated: Because this is stated,

original: gang gi tshe blos sgra la sogs pa'i don rgyud la gnas par byas shing skyes bu la 'bul bar byed pa de'i tshe na shes pa yod pa nyid skye'i /
analyzed: gang gi tshe blos sgra la sogs pa'i don rgyud la gnas par byas shing skyes bu la 'bul bar byed pa de'i tshe na shes pa yod pa nyid skye'i /

analyzed: ji srid du blos sgra la sogs pa don rgyud la gnas par ma byas shing skyes bu la 'bul bar mi byed pa de srid du shes pa yod pa nyid mi skye bas de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtag tu yod
translated: But as long as the mind does not make sound and so on present in the mindstream and does not offer it to the person, the existence of consciousness does not arise. Therefore the existence of consciousness is permanent by the definition of potency.

original: kyang / gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rtag tu med pas gtan tshigs yod pa nyid kyi dpe shes pa yod pa nyid las blangs pa de'i mtshan nyid ma tshang bas sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: kyang / gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rtag tu med pas gtan tshigs yod pa nyid kyi dpe shes pa yod pa nyid las blangs pa de'i mtshan nyid ma tshang bas sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: But, the opponent may say, since the definition of clarity is never absent, the example of the reason 'existence' is taken from the existence of consciousness. Since the definition is incomplete, there is a fault in the proof.ğŸ”½In response to this, the opponent's position is drawn out from within and it is said:

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras so ;
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras so ;
translated: Since the existence of consciousness is taken as having the characteristic of potentiality, there is no fault.

original: /'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: /'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gang gi tshe blo'i rtsol bas ma skyes pa'i shes pa yod pa nyid nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs na yod pa nyid gang yin pa de kho bos dpe nyid du bstan par byas pas de'i phyir dpe'i skyon med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe blo'i rtsol bas ma skyes pa'i shes pa yod pa nyid nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs na yod pa nyid gang yin pa de kho bos dpe nyid du bstan par byas pas de'i phyir dpe'i skyon med do //
translated: When the existence of consciousness that is not produced by the exertion of the mind is in the state of having the characteristic of potentiality, that existence is what I have presented as the example. Therefore, there is no fault in the example.

original: de la shes pa yod pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni sngar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs yod pa nyid kyi dper bstan pa'i shes pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la shes pa yod pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni sngar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir / dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs yod pa nyid kyi dper bstan pa'i shes pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: As for the phrase â€œthe existence of consciousness,â€ this refers to the existence of consciousness that was cited as an example of the reason â€œexistence.â€

original: nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa yod pa nyid gang la nus pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa de ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ste /ğŸ”½de yang @73a * //
analyzed: nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa yod pa nyid gang la nus pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa de ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ste / de yang @73a * //
translated: As for the phrase â€œendowed with the characteristics of potentiality,â€ this refers to the existence of consciousness that is endowed with the characteristics of potentiality.

original: grangs can gyi skyes bu la dus thams cad du yod par khas blangs pas yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: grangs can gyi skyes bu la dus thams cad du yod par khas blangs pas yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since the SÄá¹ƒkhya accepts that the puruá¹£a exists at all times, it is existent.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de kho bos yod pa nyid kyi dper yongs su gzung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi dpe la skyon med do //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de kho bos yod pa nyid kyi dper yongs su gzung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi dpe la skyon med do //
translated: As for the phrase â€œbecause it is apprehended,â€ this refers to the fact that I have accepted the existence of consciousness that is endowed with the characteristics of potentiality as an example of the reason â€œexistence.â€ Therefore, there is no fault in my example of the reason.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa 'ba' zhig yongs su bzung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi dpe la skyon med par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa 'ba' zhig yongs su bzung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi dpe la skyon med par ma zad kyi /
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ indicates that not only is the example of the reason faultless because of the inclusion of that which possesses the characteristic of potentiality,

original: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang gtan tshigs kyi dpe la skyon med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang gtan tshigs kyi dpe la skyon med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but also the example of the reason is faultless because of the inclusion of that which possesses the characteristic of manifestation.

original: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gtan tshigs yod pa nyid kyi dper shes pa yod pa nyid bstan pa la dpe'i skyon gyis nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gtan tshigs yod pa nyid kyi dper shes pa yod pa nyid bstan pa la dpe'i skyon gyis nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthere is no faultâ€ means that in teaching the existence of consciousness as an example of the existence of the reason, there is no fault of the example because of the fault of the reason.

original: 'di la gzhan ni dngos po rnams bdag gi bdag nyid las skye ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan ni dngos po rnams bdag gi bdag nyid las skye ba med de /
translated: Here, another says: Things do not arise from themselves,

original: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / skye ba thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / skye ba thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their arising would be pointless and because there would be an infinite regress of arising.

original: zhes rnam par bshad par byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs 'di la 'grel ba byed pa slob dpon buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad du rnam par bshad par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
