original: de'i phyir dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang zhes smras pas med par dgag pa dang / dbu ma'i bstan bcos ni dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa dang / dgag pa gtso che ba'i 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang zhes smras pas med par dgag pa dang / dbu ma'i bstan bcos ni dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa dang / dgag pa gtso che ba'i 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
translated: Because it was said, â€œbecause the negation is primary,â€ and because it was explained that â€œthe treatise of the middle way is a nonimplicative negation because the negation is primary,â€ and because it was said, â€œWhat is the result of the negation being primary?â€

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pas /
translated: Therefore, since it is the intention to establish nonconceptual gnosis endowed with all objects of knowledge by refuting all the nets of misconceptions,

original: dgag pa gtso che bas rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kun rdzob kyi rnam par gzhag pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa
analyzed: dgag pa gtso che bas rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kun rdzob kyi rnam par gzhag pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa
translated: it is explained that since negation is primary, by refuting all the nets of misconceptions, it is the intention to establish supramundane conventional reality, which is nonconceptual gnosis endowed with all objects of knowledge.

original: dang / ma yin par dgag pa yongs su bzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes bsgrubs pas skye ba med par @78b ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang / ma yin par dgag pa yongs su bzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes bsgrubs pas skye ba med par @78b ston pa'i phyir /
translated: If you accept that it is an implicative negation, then since it is primary to establish that, it is established that phenomena are not produced, and since it teaches that they are not produced,

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: it would be devoid of activity.

original: lung las / gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pas /
analyzed: lung las / gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pas /
translated: If one engages in the nonarising of form, one does not engage in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ma yin par dgag par yongs su gzung ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa dang / 'dir dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag par yongs su gzung ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa dang / 'dir dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The fault of apprehending nonexistence is taught, and here one should apprehend that things definitely do not arise from themselves.

original: gzhan du nges par gzung na bdag kho na las skye ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan du nges par gzung na bdag kho na las skye ba med de /
translated: If one apprehends otherwise, one would apprehend that things definitely do not arise from themselves alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But if they do not arise from themselves, then what?ğŸ”½One would apprehend that they arise from another.

original: gzhan las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du bdag kho na las ni skye ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du bdag kho na las ni skye ba med de /
translated: Similarly, one would apprehend that things definitely do not arise from themselves alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But if they do not arise from themselves, then what?

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur bas de yang mi bzhed de /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur bas de yang mi bzhed de /
translated: One would apprehend that they arise from both self and other.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pas /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pas /
translated: But that is unacceptable because it is devoid of activity.

original: nges par gzung ba rnam pa gsum las dang po ltar gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba rnam pa gsum las dang po ltar gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The three kinds of definite descriptions are as follows:ğŸ”½If one were to take the first, then it would follow, absurdly, that arising from another and arising from both self and other are also being accepted.

original: nges par gzung ba gnyis pa dang gsum pa ltar gzung na gzhan las skye ba dang / bdag dang gzhan las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa bzhin du 'dir yang gzhan las min zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba gnyis pa dang gsum pa ltar gzung na gzhan las skye ba dang / bdag dang gzhan las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa bzhin du 'dir yang gzhan las min zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni med par dgag pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /
translated: If one were to take the second and third, then it would follow, absurdly, that arising from another and arising from both self and other are also being accepted.

original: dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang / 'di ltar rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gtso che ba'i phyir dang / 'di ltar rtog pa ma lus pa'i dra ba dgag pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes bya yul ma lus pa dang ldan pa 'grub par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as it is in this case, so too should one view the negation in the phrase not from another as a nonimplicative negation, for the negation is the more important of the two and because it is the intention of the master to establish the nonconceptual gnosis that is endowed with all objects of knowledge by means of the negation of all the nets of conceptual thought.

original: ma yin par dgag pa yongs su gzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes bsgrubs pas skye ba med par ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa yongs su gzung na ni de sgrub pa gtso che ba'i phyir chos rnams ma skyes so zhes bsgrubs pas skye ba med par ston pa'i phyir /
translated: If one were to take it as an implicative negation, then because the establishment of the predicate would be the more important of the two, the statement all phenomena are not produced would be established as teaching nonarising.

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar gyur te /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral bar gyur te /
translated: And the master would be guilty of the fallacy of having a thesis that is inconsistent with his own system.

original: lung las / gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung las / gzugs kyi skye ba med pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one engages in the non-arising of form, one does not engage in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, one should ascertain that things are definitely not produced from other.

original: gzhan du nges par gzung na gzhan kho na las skye ba med de /ğŸ”½'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du nges par gzung na gzhan kho na las skye ba med de / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If one ascertains that they are not produced from other, then one ascertains that they are not produced from other alone.

original: bdag las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du gzhan kho na las ni skye ba med de /ğŸ”½'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: bdag las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du gzhan kho na las ni skye ba med de / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But if one ascertains that they are not produced from other, then one ascertains that they are produced from self alone.

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye'o zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur bas /
translated: And if one ascertains that they are not produced from other, then one ascertains that they are produced from self and other.

original: de yang mi bzhed de /
analyzed: de yang mi bzhed de /
translated: But that is not accepted,

original: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro @79a * //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro @79a * //
translated: because it is devoid of activity.

original: zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la re zhig dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar ni rigs te /
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar ni rigs te /
translated: First, it is logical that things are not produced from self,

original: 'di ltar thams cad kyang bdag gi don kho nar rtsol bar byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad kyang bdag gi don kho nar rtsol bar byed kyi /
translated: Thus, all things strive only for their own purpose.ğŸ”½They do not strive for the purpose of others.

original: gzhan gyi don du rtsol bar mi byed pa yin na de la gang gi tshe dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar ma grub pa de'i tshe na gzhan ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa tha dad pa las lta skye bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du rtsol bar mi byed pa yin na de la gang gi tshe dngos po rnams bdag las skye bar ma grub pa de'i tshe na gzhan ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa tha dad pa las lta skye bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: When it is not established that things arise from themselves, how could they arise from others that are different in nature and type?

original: dper na me ni ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa tha dad pa'i chu las skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na me ni ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa tha dad pa'i chu las skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, fire does not arise from water that is different in nature and type.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med ce na /
translated: Why do things not arise from others?

original: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the reason,

original: 'dir yang gzhan gyi gzhan nyid chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan gyi gzhan nyid chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: here it is said that since the otherness of the other is a property, the property of the subject is evident.

original: ji skad bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan zhe na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: ji ltar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: ji ltar nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med pa'i phyogs la /
translated: In the context of the position that the internal sense sources do not arise from self,

original: phyogs kyi chos yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'dir 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan du 'gyur ba rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan las skye ba med pa'i phyogs la yang rkyen mer mer po
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'dir 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan du 'gyur ba rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan las skye ba med pa'i phyogs la yang rkyen mer mer po
translated: Just as the property of the subject exists, so too in this context, in the case of the subject, the internal sense sources such as the eye that are the effect, which do not arise from other conditions such as the oval stage and the oblong stage, the other conditions such as the oval stage and the oblong stage are the property of the subject because they are the property of the subject that is the internal sense sources such as the eye that are the effect, which do not arise from other conditions such as the oval stage and the oblong stage.

original: dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan gyi 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid dang / 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid kyi rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan nyid ni sgrub pa'i chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos mngon pa ste /
analyzed: dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan gyi 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid dang / 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid kyi rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan nyid ni sgrub pa'i chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos mngon pa ste /
translated: The otherness of the internal sense sources such as the eye that are the effect is the property of the subject because it is the property of the subject that is the internal sense sources such as the eye that are the effect, which do not arise from other conditions such as the oval stage and the oblong stage.

original: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams dang / rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams phan tshun gzhan nyid du yod pa ni phyogs kyi chos yin pas de'i phyir phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams dang / rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams phan tshun gzhan nyid du yod pa ni phyogs kyi chos yin pas de'i phyir phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bstan to //
translated: The effect, the internal sense bases such as the eye, and the conditions such as the oval stage and the oblong stage, exist as different from each other.

original: de la 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: de la 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs 'dir yang ngo //
translated: Here also means in this context of proving that things do not arise from other.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams la ltos na gzhan du gyur pa rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan gyi dang / rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams la ltos na gzhan du gyur pa 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams la ltos na gzhan du gyur pa rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan gyi dang / rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams la ltos na gzhan du gyur pa 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Other means the conditions such as the oval stage and the oblong stage are other in relation to the effect, the internal sense bases such as the eye, and the effect, the internal sense bases such as the eye, are other in relation to the conditions such as the oval stage and the oblong stage.

original: gzhan nyid @79b ces bya ba ni rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos pa'i gzhan nyid de /ğŸ”½'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba de dag la ltos nas gzhan nyid du yod pa nyid dang / 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos pa'i gzhan nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan nyid @79b ces bya ba ni rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos pa'i gzhan nyid de / 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba de dag la ltos nas gzhan nyid du yod pa nyid dang / 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos pa'i gzhan nyid de /
translated: â€œOthernessâ€ is the otherness that depends on the otherness of the conditions such as the oval shape and the oblong shape.ğŸ”½The effect, the internal sources such as the eye, exists as other in dependence on the otherness of the conditions such as the oval shape and the oblong shape.

original: rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos nas gzhan nyid du yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos nas gzhan nyid du yod pa nyid do //
translated: The conditions such as the oval shape and the oblong shape exist as other in dependence on the otherness of the effect, the internal sources such as the eye.

original: chos ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos yin pas te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos yin pas te /
translated: â€œNon-dharmaâ€ means the dharma of proof.

original: de ltar rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos nas 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan nyid du yod pa nyid dang / 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos nas rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams gzhan nyid du yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras las skye ba med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos nas 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan nyid du yod pa nyid dang / 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos nas rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams gzhan nyid du yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras las skye ba med pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since that which is other does not arise from another,

original: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang med pa sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang med pa sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: the internal sense bases such as the eyes are established as not existing prior to the conditions.

original: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos nas gzhan nyid du yod pa de la ni yang gzhan las skye ba med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos nas gzhan nyid du yod pa de la ni yang gzhan las skye ba med pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since that which is other does not arise from another, the internal sense bases such as the eyes, in dependence on the other-transformation of the conditions such as the oval and oblong stages, are established as not existing prior to the conditions.

original: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid ces bya ba de yang gzhan las skye ba med pa sgrub pa'i chos yin la /ğŸ”½rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams gzhan nyid du yod pa de la ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid du yod pa'i rkyen ma yin pas de'i phyir rgyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs
analyzed: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid ces bya ba de yang gzhan las skye ba med pa sgrub pa'i chos yin la / rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa rnams gzhan nyid du yod pa de la ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid du yod pa'i rkyen ma yin pas de'i phyir rgyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs
translated: The other internal sense bases, such as the eye, which are the effect, are also a phenomenon that proves that they do not arise from other.ğŸ”½The conditions such as the oval and oblong stages do not exist as other, and the other internal sense bases, such as the eye, which are the effect, are not conditions that exist as other.

original: pa rnams gzhan nyid ces bya ba de yang gzhan las skye ba med pa sgrub pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: pa rnams gzhan nyid ces bya ba de yang gzhan las skye ba med pa sgrub pa'i chos yin no //
translated: Therefore, the other conditions such as the oval and oblong stages are also a phenomenon that proves that they do not arise from other.

original: phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The property of the subject has been stated.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi gzhan nyid sgrub pa'i chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos mngon te /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi gzhan nyid sgrub pa'i chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos mngon te /
translated: The property of the subject has been stated in this way because the otherness of the other is a phenomenon that proves that.

original: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan las skye ba @80a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan las skye ba @80a * //
translated: The internal sense bases, such as the eye, which are the effect, arise from other conditions, such as the oval and oblong stages.

original: med par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs la yang gtan tshigs gzhan nyid yin la rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid du yod pa'i rkyen ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs la yang
analyzed: med par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs la yang gtan tshigs gzhan nyid yin la rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched gzhan nyid du yod pa'i rkyen ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs la yang
translated: Also, in the case of the position that is to be established as nonexistent, the reason is â€œbecause of being different.â€

original: gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba de kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba de kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, in the case of the position that establishes that the other inner sense bases, such as the eye, are not conditions that are different from other conditions, such as the oval and oblong stages, the reason is â€œbecause of being different.â€

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The example is by the power of that.

original: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te/ bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos grags pa dang ldan pa'i chos can gyi dpe yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis te/ bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos grags pa dang ldan pa'i chos can gyi dpe yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example is by the power of the property of the thesis and the property of the reason because the example is a subject that possesses the property of the thesis and the property of the reason.

original: de'i zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dang sbyar te /
translated: The word â€œthatâ€ is connected to the property of the thesis and the property of the reason.

original: dpe gang la phyogs dang mthun par bsgrub par bya ba chos gzhan las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gzhan nyid ces bya ba yod pa de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe gang la phyogs dang mthun par bsgrub par bya ba chos gzhan las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gzhan nyid ces bya ba yod pa de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Whatever example has the probandum, which is the non-existence of production from another, and the proving property, which is â€œanotherness,â€ that is a similar example.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med par bstan pa'i skabs 'dir sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni 'og nas chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams gzhan las skye ba med par bstan pa'i skabs 'dir sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni 'og nas chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the statement â€œthe words of the syllogismâ€ means that in this context of demonstrating that things do not arise from others, the words of the syllogism are the subject, the probandum predicate, the proving property, and the example.

original: de la sbyor ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Here â€œthe words of the syllogismâ€ means the words of the syllogism that has the three modes.

original: rjes su dpag pa gtan tshigs dang dpe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gtan tshigs dang dpe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œHaving an inferenceâ€ means having a reason and an example.

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sense spheres do not arise from other conditions because

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: they are other, like a pot.

original: don dam par zhes bya ba ni sngar gzhan ma yin pa ni 'dir thams cad don dam par bkag ste nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½gzhan du yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: don dam par zhes bya ba ni sngar gzhan ma yin pa ni 'dir thams cad don dam par bkag ste nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro // gzhan du yang mi 'gal te /
translated: Here, â€œultimatelyâ€ is applied to the negation of nondifference, since it is ascertained to be a negation in all cases.

original: khyad par gyi gzhi'i khyad par ji skad bstan pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir dang / mdzad pa pos bstan pa nyid kyis bzhed pa mchog yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes smras pas /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gzhi'i khyad par ji skad bstan pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir dang / mdzad pa pos bstan pa nyid kyis bzhed pa mchog yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes smras pas /
translated: It is not contradictory to say â€œultimatelyâ€ because there is no contradiction in the particular of the basis of distinction as it is taught, and because the supreme intention is accepted by the teacher himself.

original: 'dir gzhan las skye ba med par dgag pa yang don dam pas dgag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan las skye ba med par dgag pa yang don dam pas dgag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the negation of nonarising from other is applied to the negation of arising from other ultimately.

original: de la don dam par zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzhan las skye ba rdzas dang dngos po dang dngos gzhi'i sgo nas dgag pa ste /
analyzed: de la don dam par zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzhan las skye ba rdzas dang dngos po dang dngos gzhi'i sgo nas dgag pa ste /
translated: Here, â€œultimatelyâ€ means that arising from other is negated ultimately in terms of substance, entity, and basis.

original: de yang @80b kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnas nas don dam pa'i yul la dgag par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang @80b kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnas nas don dam pa'i yul la dgag par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the object of refutation is in relation to the object of the ultimate truth, while remaining in the conventional truth.

original: don dam pa nyid du ni brjod pa med pa'i phyir dgag pa'i tha snyad kyang med do //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid du ni brjod pa med pa'i phyir dgag pa'i tha snyad kyang med do //
translated: But in the ultimate itself, there is no conventional expression, and so there is no expression of refutation.

original: de la nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag par bya ba phyogs te chos can yin no //ğŸ”½de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag pa phyogs te bsgrub par bya ba chos yin no //
analyzed: de la nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag par bya ba phyogs te chos can yin no // de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag pa phyogs te bsgrub par bya ba chos yin no //
translated: In this regard, the so-called internal sense bases are the subject of inference.ğŸ”½The statement â€œThey are not produced from other conditionsâ€ is the thesis of inference.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs te phyogs kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs te phyogs kyi chos yin no //
translated: The statement â€œBecause they are otherâ€ is the reason that proves the thesis, and it is a property of the subject.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe ste /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe ste /
translated: The statement â€œFor example, like a potâ€ is the example.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: It is a similar example.

original: de la nang gi zhes bya ba ni bdag gis byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi zhes bya ba ni bdag gis byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa'o //
translated: In this regard, â€œinternalâ€ means that which is empowered and appropriated by the self.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni mtshams la bdag gir byed pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni mtshams la bdag gir byed pa ste /
translated: The self is that which appropriates the stages of existence.

original: yo byad gya nom pa dang / rgya chen po dag dang por byas nas yo byad ngan pa dang / khyon chung ngu'i bar dag la bdag gir byed pas bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad gya nom pa dang / rgya chen po dag dang por byas nas yo byad ngan pa dang / khyon chung ngu'i bar dag la bdag gir byed pas bdag ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the self because it appropriates the stages of existence, beginning with the most excellent and extensive, and ending with the least excellent and least extensive.

original: bdag nges byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa ni nang gi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nges byin gyis brlabs shing gnas su byas pa ni nang gi zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is consecrated as the self and is the basis of the self is called internal.

original: skye mched rnams zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'byung ba dang / mched cing rgyas par byed pas skye mched rnams te /
analyzed: skye mched rnams zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'byung ba dang / mched cing rgyas par byed pas skye mched rnams te /
translated: The sense-spheres are so called because the mind and mental factors arise, originate, and expand in them.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba rnams so //
translated: the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag par bya ba phyogs te chos can yin no //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag par bya ba phyogs te chos can yin no //
translated: The internal sense-spheres are the subject to be inferred.

original: de la rjes su dpag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni gang la mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa dang ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni gang la mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa dang ngo bo nyid las mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: The basis of inference is that which is inferred, such as the nonexistence of a thing from the nonapprehension of it, impermanence from the nature of an entity, and the cause from the effect.

original: skabs 'dir ni gang la de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gzhi nang gi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gang la de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gzhi nang gi skye mched rnams so //
translated: In this context, the basis of inference is the internal sense bases, which are the basis for the inference that they are not produced from other conditions.

original: de nyid phyogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid phyogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That itself is the position.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can bsdus pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can bsdus pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The position is the position that includes the property and the subject.

original: skabs 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / gang la de bsgrub par bya ba'i gzhi chos can nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba de gnyis bsdus pa'i @81a * //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / gang la de bsgrub par bya ba'i gzhi chos can nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba de gnyis bsdus pa'i @81a * //
translated: In this context, the position is the position that includes the two: the property to be established, which is that they are not produced from other conditions, and the subject, which is the basis of the property to be established, the internal sense bases.

original: phyogs la phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs la phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The reason is the property that is the sign.ğŸ”½The reason is the property that is the sign.

original: de nyid chos can zhes bya ste rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gzhi gang la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gnyis yod pa de ni chos can te /
analyzed: de nyid chos can zhes bya ste rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gzhi gang la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gnyis yod pa de ni chos can te /
translated: That is called the subject, because it is the basis of the object to be inferred, on which both the property to be established and the establishing property exist.

original: skabs 'dir ni nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba gzhi gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa dang / de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa de sgrub pa'i chos gzhan nyid ces bya ba rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa de gnyis yod pa de ni chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba gzhi gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa dang / de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa de sgrub pa'i chos gzhan nyid ces bya ba rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa de gnyis yod pa de ni chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: In this context, the â€œinternal sense spheresâ€ is the basis on which both the property to be established, â€œnot arising from other conditions,â€ which is known to both parties in the debate, and the establishing property, â€œnot arising from other conditions,â€ which is known to both parties in the debate, exist. That is called the subject.

original: de dag gi rkyen zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched de dag gi rkyen khyad par can no //
analyzed: de dag gi rkyen zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched de dag gi rkyen khyad par can no //
translated: â€œTheir conditionsâ€ refers to the specific conditions of those internal sense spheres.

original: gzhan dag las zhes bya ba ni rkyen khyad par can mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa 'bras bu las gzhan du gyur ba dag las so //
analyzed: gzhan dag las zhes bya ba ni rkyen khyad par can mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa 'bras bu las gzhan du gyur ba dag las so //
translated: â€œFrom othersâ€ refers to the special conditions of the embryo, such as the kalala, arbuda, and so on, which are different from the effect.

original: skye ba med de zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med de zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa'o //
translated: â€œThere is no arisingâ€ means that the internal sense bases do not arise from those conditions that are different from them.

original: ci'i phyir nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan las skye ba med par dam bca' ba 'di la de dag gi rkyen zhes bya ba dang / gzhan dag las zhes bya ba khyad par gnyis smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan las skye ba med par dam bca' ba 'di la de dag gi rkyen zhes bya ba dang / gzhan dag las zhes bya ba khyad par gnyis smos she na /
translated: Why is it that in this thesis that the internal sense bases do not arise from others, the two distinctions â€œtheir conditionsâ€ and â€œfrom othersâ€ are mentioned?

original: 'di ltar gal te nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan dag las skye ba med de zhes bya ba de tsam zhig smos su zin na ni de'i tshe gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan dag las skye ba med de zhes bya ba de tsam zhig smos su zin na ni de'i tshe gzhan dag na re /
translated: If it were stated simply that â€œthe internal sense bases do not arise from others,â€ then the other schools would say,ğŸ”½â€œ

original: nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / rgyu spun la sogs pa gzhan dag las skye ba med par 'jig rten thams cad la grags zin pa la /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / rgyu spun la sogs pa gzhan dag las skye ba med par 'jig rten thams cad la grags zin pa la /
translated: The internal sense bases are not produced from other conditions, such as the seeds, earth, water, fire, wind, space, time, and the two parents. This is already well known to everyone in the world.

original: da khyed kyi nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan dag las skye ba med da zhes sgrub pa 'di ni grub pa las sgrub pa yin no zhes zer bas /
analyzed: da khyed kyi nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan dag las skye ba med da zhes sgrub pa 'di ni grub pa las sgrub pa yin no zhes zer bas /
translated: Now, your proof that â€œthe internal sense bases are not produced from other conditionsâ€ is a proof of what is already established.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir de dag gi rkyen zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir de dag gi rkyen zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to dispel that, the root text says, â€œTheir conditions.â€

original: gal te nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen las skye ba med de zhes bya ba de tsam zhig smos su zin na yang /
analyzed: gal te nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen las skye ba med de zhes bya ba de tsam zhig smos su zin na yang /
translated: If you say, â€œThe internal sense bases are not produced from their conditions,â€

original: de'i tshe phyogs la gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du ma byas bas phyogs kyi chos nyid gtan tshigs su mi rung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyogs la gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du ma byas bas phyogs kyi chos nyid gtan tshigs su mi rung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: then, since you do not specify the basis of the argument, the property of that subject cannot be a correct reason.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dag las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dag las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œfrom other conditions.â€

original: de dag gi rkyen gzhan @81b dag las skye ba med de zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag pa phyogs te bsgrub par bya ba chos yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rkyen gzhan @81b dag las skye ba med de zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag pa phyogs te bsgrub par bya ba chos yin no //
translated: The non-existence of arising from other conditions is the logical argument, the property to be established.ğŸ”½In this context, â€œlogical argumentâ€ means the inference of non-existence from non-apprehension, the inference of impermanence from the nature of things, the inference of cause from effect, and the inference of effect from cause.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa dang / ngo bo nyid la mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa dang / skabs 'dir ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gzhi nang gi skye mched rnams la de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa dang / ngo bo nyid la mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa dang / 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa dang / skabs 'dir ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i gzhi nang gi skye mched rnams la de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Here, the logical argument is the inference of the non-existence of arising from other conditions in regard to the internal sense bases, which are the basis of the logical argument.

original: de nyid phyogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid phyogs zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the â€œposition.â€

original: phyogs zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can bsdus pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can bsdus pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The â€œpositionâ€ is the position that includes the property to be established and the property of the subject.

original: skabs 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / gang la de bsgrub par bya ba'i gzhi chos can nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba de gnyis bsdus pa'i phyogs la phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / gang la de bsgrub par bya ba'i gzhi chos can nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba de gnyis bsdus pa'i phyogs la phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: In this context, the â€œproperty to be establishedâ€ is the non-arising of those phenomena from other conditions, and the â€œsubjectâ€ is the basis upon which that property is to be established, namely, the internal sense spheres.

original: de gnyis bsgrub par bya ba chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis bsgrub par bya ba chos zhes bya ste /
translated: These two are called the â€œposition.â€

original: bsgrub par bya ba chos zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / rgyu ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba chos zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / rgyu ste /
translated: The â€œproperty to be establishedâ€ is said to be non-existence, impermanence, and cause.

original: skabs 'dir ni chos can nang gi skye mched rnams la bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa de bsgrub par bya'o //ğŸ”½gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni chos can nang gi skye mched rnams la bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa de bsgrub par bya'o // gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams /
translated: In this context, the property to be established is the non-arising of those phenomena from other conditions in relation to the subject, the internal sense spheres.ğŸ”½The reason is â€œbecause they are other.â€

original: rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos na gzhan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos na gzhan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The internal sense spheres, such as the eye, which are the effects, are other than the other-dependent conditions, such as the oval and oblong stages.

original: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos na /
analyzed: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag la ltos na /
translated: The internal sense bases such as the eye, which are the effects, are different from their conditions such as the embryonic stage of kalala.

original: gzhan nyid yin pa de la ni yang gzhan las skye ba med pas /ğŸ”½de'i phyir 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin pa de la ni yang gzhan las skye ba med pas / de'i phyir 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if they are different, they do not arise from other conditions.

original: de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the internal sense bases such as the eye, which are the effects, do not arise from other conditions.ğŸ”½Why? Because they are different.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs te phyogs kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs te phyogs kyi chos yin no //
translated: The reason â€œbecause they are differentâ€ is a property of the position.

original: de la sgrub pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / rgyu sgrub pa'i chos mi dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / rgyu sgrub pa'i chos mi dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang 'bras bu ste /
translated: The property of the probandum is a non-entity, impermanence, the property of the probandum that is the non-observation of a cause, and the property of the probandum that is an essence and an effect.

original: skabs 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de sgrub pa'i chos gzhan @82a * //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa zhes bya ba de sgrub pa'i chos gzhan @82a * //
translated: In this context, the property of the probandum is the non-arising of those internal sense bases from other conditions.

original: yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of that.

The predicate is the property to be proven, called definitely not a condition. The reason is the property that proves that, called different from that. analyzed: skabs 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos can ma yin par nges pa zhes bya ba de /

translated: The property to be proven is â€œbecause it is different.â€ğŸ”½Thus, in relation to the effects, the internal sense bases that are different from the conditions such as the oval shape and the oblong shape, they are different.

analyzed: gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag / ci'i phyir rkyen ma yin par nges she na /

original: rgyu 'dis ni rgyu spun la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par 'dod do zhes khyad par nyid du bya ba'i khyad par gyi gtan tshigs brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis ni rgyu spun la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par 'dod do zhes khyad par nyid du bya ba'i khyad par gyi gtan tshigs brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: If you assert that the conditions are not the seed and so on, then you must state a reason that distinguishes the conditions from the seed and so on, saying, â€œThe conditions are asserted to be the internal sources such as the eyes that are established by other causes that are asserted to be other than the seed and so on.â€

original: gang gi phyir rkyen du smra ba dag rgyu spun la sogs pa gzhan nyid yin pa'i gnas skabs dag rkyen yin par mi 'dod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen du smra ba dag rgyu spun la sogs pa gzhan nyid yin pa'i gnas skabs dag rkyen yin par mi 'dod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the proponents of conditions do not assert that the seed and so on are conditions when they are other,

original: gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag kyang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir rkyen ma yin par nges par grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag kyang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir rkyen ma yin par nges par grub bo //
translated: it is definitely established that the internal sources such as the eyes that are established by other causes that are asserted to be other than the seed and so on are not conditions.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi rkyen nyid ci'i phyir 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi rkyen nyid ci'i phyir 'dod ce na /
translated: Moreover, why do you assert that things have conditions?

original: gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma thob pa thob par byed pa'i phyir rkyen du 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma thob pa thob par byed pa'i phyir rkyen du 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If you assert that conditions are for the purpose of obtaining that which has not yet obtained the nature of being different,

original: gal te gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa de dag rkyen du 'gyur ba'i snga rol na gzhan nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa de dag rkyen du 'gyur ba'i snga rol na gzhan nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: if those eyes and so on that are asserted to be different and that are conditions for establishing the internal sense bases were different prior to being conditions,

original: de dag la rkyen yin par brtag pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la rkyen yin par brtag pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: then what would be the point of investigating whether they are conditions?

original: gzhan nyid ni gzhan gyi rkyen ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni gzhan gyi rkyen ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, â€œDifference is not a condition of another.â€

original: gzhan yang dgag pa mi mthun par yang 'gyur te /ğŸ”½gal te gzhan nyid yin na ni gzhan gyi rkyen ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgag pa mi mthun par yang 'gyur te / gal te gzhan nyid yin na ni gzhan gyi rkyen ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, the refutation would be inconsistent.ğŸ”½If they are different, they are not conditions of another.

original: ci ste gzhan gyi rkyen yin na ni gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyi rkyen yin na ni gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: But if they are conditions of another, they are not different.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten na gzhan nyid gzhan gyi rkyen yin pa ni 'gal te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten na gzhan nyid gzhan gyi rkyen yin pa ni 'gal te /
translated: Moreover, in the world, it is contradictory for difference to be a condition of another.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na bum pa sbrang rtsi dang / chu dang / 'o ma 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed nus pa gsal ba gzhan nyid yin pa ni gzhan gyi rkyen yin par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad kyi rkyen /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na bum pa sbrang rtsi dang / chu dang / 'o ma 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed nus pa gsal ba gzhan nyid yin pa ni gzhan gyi rkyen yin par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro // don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad kyi rkyen /
translated: For, in the world, a vase is seen to be a different thing from the other things that it can hold, such as honey, water, and milk.

original: rkyen ma yin par dgag pa yin na /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin par dgag pa yin na /
translated: The ultimate truth is the negation of the conditionality of all internal and external things.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag nyi tshe chos can du bzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag nyi tshe chos can du bzhag ce na /
translated: Why then is it that only the internal sense bases, such as the eyes, which are asserted to be conditions, are taken as the subjects of the syllogism?ğŸ”½The answer is that the emptiness of one thing is the emptiness of all.ğŸ”½The emptiness of one thing is the emptiness of all.ğŸ”½This is the reasoning that is stated in the following lines:

original: de ni / dngos po gcig la gang mthong ba //
analyzed: de ni / dngos po gcig la gang mthong ba //
translated: What is seen in one thing

original: de ni kun la'ang mthong bar 'dod //
analyzed: de ni kun la'ang mthong bar 'dod //
translated: Is also seen in all things.

original: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
translated: The emptiness of one thing

original: de nyid kun gyi stong pa nyid //ğŸ”½ces gsungs pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: de nyid kun gyi stong pa nyid //ğŸ”½ces gsungs pa'i rigs pas /
translated: Is the emptiness of all.

original: gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par grub na phyi rol gyi rkyen la sogs pa rkyen thams cad kyang rkyen ma yin pa nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir dang / gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa @88a * //ğŸ”½nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag chos can du bzhag na /
analyzed: gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par grub na phyi rol gyi rkyen la sogs pa rkyen thams cad kyang rkyen ma yin pa nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir dang / gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa @88a * // nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag chos can du bzhag na /
translated: If it is established that other things that are asserted to be causes, such as the internal sources such as the eyes, are not conditions, then all conditions, such as external conditions, are established as not being conditions.ğŸ”½If other things that are asserted to be causes, such as the internal sources such as the eyes, are posited as the subject,

original: phyi rol gyi rkyen la sogs pa gzhan dag gtan tshigs dang dper gzhag tu rung bas de'i phyir 'dir gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag nyi tshe chos can du gzhag go //ğŸ”½/ bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rkyen la sogs pa gzhan dag gtan tshigs dang dper gzhag tu rung bas de'i phyir 'dir gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag nyi tshe chos can du gzhag go // / bam po bcu pa /
translated: then it is suitable to posit other things, such as external conditions, as the reason and example. Therefore, in this context, only other things that are asserted to be causes, such as the internal sources such as the eyes, are posited as the subject.

original: 'di la gzhan slob dpon blo brtan gyis bdag nyid kyi 'grel pa byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan nyid ces bya ba 'di 'gal te /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan slob dpon blo brtan gyis bdag nyid kyi 'grel pa byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan nyid ces bya ba 'di 'gal te /
translated: Here, the other master Sthiramati, in his commentary, contradicts the definition of a reason, saying, â€œIt is contradictory.â€

original: 'di ltar dbu ma pas mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu khas len cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbu ma pas mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu khas len cing /
translated: In this way, the Followers of the Middle Way conventionally accept that the conditions of the inner sense sources, such as the eyes, are things like the oval-shaped embryo and the oblong-shaped embryo.

original: de ltar khas blangs nas gang gi tshe don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa mer mer po la sogs pa dag nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: de ltar khas blangs nas gang gi tshe don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa mer mer po la sogs pa dag nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen ma yin par nges te /
translated: When they accept that and then wish to express the ultimate, they will definitely say that things like the oval-shaped embryo are not the conditions of the inner sense sources, such as the eyes.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because they are other than the sense sources.ğŸ”½The syllogism is stated as follows: â€œThe subject, things like the oval-shaped embryo, are not the conditions of the inner sense sources because they are other than the sense sources.ğŸ”½They are other than the sense sources, just like causes such as thread.â€

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes sbyor ba'i tshig de lta bur byed pa de'i tshe /ğŸ”½ji ltar don dam par rgyu spun la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes sbyor ba'i tshig de lta bur byed pa de'i tshe /ğŸ”½ji ltar don dam par rgyu spun la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: When the Followers of the Middle Way use syllogisms such as this one, they do so in a way that is similar to the way the Proponents of Things use syllogisms.

original: kun rdzob tu yang rgyu spun la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin pa dang 'dra bar mer mer po la sogs pa yang rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin du yang kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang rgyu spun la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin pa dang 'dra bar mer mer po la sogs pa yang rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin du yang kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the conditions of the eyes and so on are not the conditions of the eyes and so on even conventionally, in the same way, the conditions of the eyes and so on are not the conditions of the eyes and so on even conventionally.

original: des na gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba de rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kun rdzob tu mig la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid ma yin par sgrub pa 'gal te /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba de rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kun rdzob tu mig la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid ma yin par sgrub pa 'gal te /
translated: Therefore, the reason â€œbecause they are differentâ€ proves that the conditions of the eyes and so on are not the conditions of the eyes and so on even conventionally.

original: ji skad du /ğŸ”½chos dang chos can de gnyis kyi //
analyzed: ji skad du / chos dang chos can de gnyis kyi //
translated: As it is said:ğŸ”½The nature of the difference

original: khyad par gyi ni ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: khyad par gyi ni ngo bo nyid //
translated: between the phenomenon and the attribute

original: log par sgrub phyir 'gal ba ni //
analyzed: log par sgrub phyir 'gal ba ni //
translated: is established as contradictoryğŸ”½because it is established as the opposite.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes dris pas 'dir de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes dris pas 'dir de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: If you ask this, then we would say the following:

original: de ltar gyur na kho bo'i gtan tshigs de 'gal yang bden grang na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na kho bo'i gtan tshigs de 'gal yang bden grang na /
translated: If that were the case, then even though our reason would be contradictory, it would be true.

original: gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig le 'ur byed pa 'di'i rtsa ba bzhi pa ma thos sam ci na /
analyzed: gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig le 'ur byed pa 'di'i rtsa ba bzhi pa ma thos sam ci na /
translated: The elder Sthiramati has not heard the fourth verse of this treatise on the definition of contradiction, or what?

original: de'i phyir khyad par med pa kho nar kho bo la gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i skyon 'di lta bu rjod par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par med pa kho nar kho bo la gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i skyon 'di lta bu rjod par byed /
translated: Therefore, without any distinction, he says that this fault of contradiction applies to my reason.

original: 'di ltar 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byed pa 'di'i rtsa ba bzhi pa las /ğŸ”½gnod pa med na @88b 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig le'ur byed pa 'di'i rtsa ba bzhi pa las / gnod pa med na @88b 'gal ba yin //
translated: The fourth verse of this treatise on the definition of contradiction states:

original: zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas /
translated: If it is not undermined, it is contradictory.

original: gal te gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de nyid la lung gi gnod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi gnod pa dang / rang gi tshig gi gnod pa dang / mngon sum gyi gnod pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa med na ni de'i tshe kho bo'i gtan tshigs de 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de nyid la lung gi gnod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi gnod pa dang / rang gi tshig gi gnod pa dang / mngon sum gyi gnod pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa med na ni de'i tshe kho bo'i gtan tshigs de 'gal ba yin no //
translated: If the elder Sthiramatiâ€™s statement of contradiction is not undermined by scripture, by the world, by his own words, by perception, or by inference, then at that time my reason would be contradictory.

original: ci ste gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de nyid la gnod pa lnga po de dag las thams cad 'ga' zhig yod na ni de'i tshe kho bo'i gtan tshigs de 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de nyid la gnod pa lnga po de dag las thams cad 'ga' zhig yod na ni de'i tshe kho bo'i gtan tshigs de 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: If any of those five faults that the elder Sthiramati mentions as contradictions are present, then at that time my reason is not contradictory.

original: gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de ni dper na ltag chod dag las 'di skad du /
analyzed: gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de ni dper na ltag chod dag las 'di skad du /
translated: The elder Sthiramatiâ€™s statement of contradiction is like the following reductio:

original: sgra ni mnyam par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni mnyam par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: â€œSound is not a product,

original: btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: because it arises immediately after being sought, like a pot.â€

original: de ltar gtan tshigs btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba de las gnod pa yod pa dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs btsal ma thag tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba de las gnod pa yod pa dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: In that way, the reason â€œarises immediately after being soughtâ€ is said to have the characteristic of being invalidated, whether it exists or not.

original: gal te mthong ba'i mthus rjes su dpag pa de ldog par mi 'gyur na ni gnod pa med pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i mthus rjes su dpag pa de ldog par mi 'gyur na ni gnod pa med pa zhig na /
translated: If it is not refuted by the power of perception, then it is not invalidated.

original: 'di la lung dang / mngon sum dang / 'jig rten las sgra ni mnyan par bya ba nyid yin par mthong ba'i mthus rjes su dpag pa de ldog par 'gyur bas gnod pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di la lung dang / mngon sum dang / 'jig rten las sgra ni mnyan par bya ba nyid yin par mthong ba'i mthus rjes su dpag pa de ldog par 'gyur bas gnod pa yod do //
translated: Here, the Buddhaâ€™s scriptures, direct perception, and the world contradict this inference.

original: 'dir gal te gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la ji ltar gnod pa yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la ji ltar gnod pa yod ce na /
translated: Here, if the elder Sthiramati states a contradiction, how is it contradicted?

original: 'di ltar gnas brtan blo brtan de yang dbu ma pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas brtan blo brtan de yang dbu ma pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: In this way, the elder Sthiramati is a Follower of the Middle Way, and therefore

original: de yang nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu khas len la /
analyzed: de yang nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu khas len la /
translated: he accepts that the conditions of the inner sense sources are relative.

original: 'dir mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smra bas /
analyzed: 'dir mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smra bas /
translated: Here, he states that the inner sense sources are not the conditions of the eyes and so on, even relatively.

original: des na dang po kho nar gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la lung dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod do //
analyzed: des na dang po kho nar gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la lung dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, the elder Sthiramatiâ€™s initial statement of a contradiction is contradicted by the scriptures.

original: kun rdzob nyid ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob nyid ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du brjod pa yin la /
translated: â€œ Relativeâ€ is a term used in the conventions of the world.

original: 'jig rten la ni nang gi skye mched rnams kun rdzob tu rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa las skye bar grags la /
analyzed: 'jig rten la ni nang gi skye mched rnams kun rdzob tu rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa las skye bar grags la /
translated: In the world, the internal sense bases are known to arise conventionally from conditions such as the kalala.

original: 'dir mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smra bas /ğŸ”½des na gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i @89a * //
analyzed: 'dir mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smra bas / des na gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i @89a * //
translated: But here, it is said that even conventionally, the kalala and so on are not conditions of the eyes and so on.

original: gnod pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gnod pa yang yod do //
translated: Therefore, the elder Sthiramatiâ€™s statement that this contradicts the world is also a refutation that contradicts direct perception.ğŸ”½Six types of eye consciousness and so on arise in the world from the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: mig la sogs pa'i gnas las kun rdzob tu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yul la dmigs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa drug po dag dbang po so so'i mngon sum du skye la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i gnas las kun rdzob tu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yul la dmigs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa drug po dag dbang po so so'i mngon sum du skye la /
translated: These six types of eye consciousness and so on are direct perceptions of each sense faculty.

original: 'dir mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smras pas /
analyzed: 'dir mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smras pas /
translated: But here, it is said that even conventionally, the kalala and so on are not conditions of the eyes and so on.

original: des na gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yang yod do //
analyzed: des na gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yang yod do //
translated: Therefore, the elder Sthiramatiâ€™s statement that this contradicts the world is also a refutation that contradicts direct perception.

original: gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa'i tshig gang yin pa de yang kun rdzob tu skye ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa'i tshig gang yin pa de yang kun rdzob tu skye ba kho na yin la /
translated: The elder Sthiramati says that the words expressing the contradiction are only conventionally produced.

original: 'dir gnas brtan blo brtan nyid kyis kun rdzob tu skye ba des mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smras pas /
analyzed: 'dir gnas brtan blo brtan nyid kyis kun rdzob tu skye ba des mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smras pas /
translated: But the elder Sthiramati himself says that the conventional production of the kalala and so on is not the condition of the eye and so on even conventionally.

original: des na gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yang yod do //
analyzed: des na gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yang yod do //
translated: Therefore, the elder Sthiramatiâ€™s words expressing the contradiction are undermined by their contradiction of his own words.

original: mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams kun rdzob tu skye ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams kun rdzob tu skye ste /
translated: The sense spheres such as the eye are conventionally produced,

original: 'ga' zhig la phan par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la phan par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because they benefit some.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, like a pot.

original: bum pa yang kun rdzob tu skye ste /
analyzed: bum pa yang kun rdzob tu skye ste /
translated: A pot is also conventionally produced,ğŸ”½because it benefits some by holding water and so on.

original: chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'ga' zhig la phan par byed pa yin pa dang 'dra bar nang gi skye mched rnams kyang kun rdzob tu skye ste /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'ga' zhig la phan par byed pa yin pa dang 'dra bar nang gi skye mched rnams kyang kun rdzob tu skye ste /
translated: In the same way, the internal sense spheres are also conventionally produced.

original: yul 'dzin pa la sogs pa nyid kyis 'ga' zhig la phan par byed pa yin pa las 'dir mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smras pas /
analyzed: yul 'dzin pa la sogs pa nyid kyis 'ga' zhig la phan par byed pa yin pa las 'dir mer mer po la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin par smras pas /
translated: It is helpful to some to apprehend objects and so on, but here you say that the embryo and so on are not conditions of the eye and so on even conventionally.

original: des na gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yang yod do //
analyzed: des na gnas brtan blo brtan gyis 'gal bar brjod pa de la rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yang yod do //
