translated: The words the sound of poetry are the subject because the predicate of the probandum, impermanent, and the reason, because it is sound in general, are both present in it.

original: mi rtag ste zhes bya ba ni snyan tshig gi sgra khyad par can de mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba ste de mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag ste zhes bya ba ni snyan tshig gi sgra khyad par can de mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba ste de mi rtag par rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: The phrase impermanent is the predicate to be proven, and the statement sound is impermanent is the inference.

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase because it is sound indicates the reason, which is a property of the subject.

original: snyan tshig gi sgra khyad par can de ci'i phyir mi rtag ce na /
analyzed: snyan tshig gi sgra khyad par can de ci'i phyir mi rtag ce na /
translated: Why is the sound of speech impermanent?

original: sgra spyi yin pa'i phyir de yang mi rtag go zhes bstan pa yin no //ğŸ”½dper na rnga bo che'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rnga bo che'i sgra zhes bya ba khyad par can de ni mi rtag ste /ğŸ”½sgra spyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar snyan tshig gi sgra khyad par can de yang mi rtag ste /
analyzed: sgra spyi yin pa'i phyir de yang mi rtag go zhes bstan pa yin no // dper na rnga bo che'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rnga bo che'i sgra zhes bya ba khyad par can de ni mi rtag ste / sgra spyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar snyan tshig gi sgra khyad par can de yang mi rtag ste /
translated: Because it is sound in general.ğŸ”½ For example, like the sound of a drum indicates the example.ğŸ”½ The statement the sound of a drum is impermanent is similar to the statement sound is impermanent because it is sound in general.

original: sgra spyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sgra spyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The statement the sound of speech is impermanent is similar to the statement sound is impermanent because it is sound in general.ğŸ”½ The statement the sound of speech is impermanent is similar to the statement the sound of a drum is impermanent because it is sound in general.

original: dper na 'di ni shing yin te shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'di ni shing yin te shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, â€œThis is a tree because it is a shinshapa tree.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: dper na sbyor ba'i tshig 'di la snyan tshig gi sgra khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la /
analyzed: dper na sbyor ba'i tshig 'di la snyan tshig gi sgra khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la /
translated: For example, in the statement, â€œThis is a verse because it is a composition,â€

original: sgra spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pas de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //ğŸ”½de bzhin du 'dir yang gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan khyad par can dag phyogs su byas pa la /
analyzed: sgra spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pas de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo // de bzhin du 'dir yang gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rkyen mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa gzhan khyad par can dag phyogs su byas pa la /
translated: the general term â€œcompositionâ€ is taught to be a property of the subject, but even though it is one part of the meaning of the thesis, it is not a correct reason.

original: gzhan spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pas de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin yang gtan tshigs su rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pas de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin yang gtan tshigs su rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, here, the other, the general term â€œother,â€ is taught to be a property of the subject, but even though it is one part of the meaning of the thesis, it is not a correct reason.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs nyid du grub pa mthong bas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs nyid du grub pa mthong bas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: â€œBecause one part of the meaning of the thesis is seen to be established as the reason itself.â€

original: 'dis ni khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la spyi phyogs kyi chos yin pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la spyi phyogs kyi chos yin pa'i don bstan to //
translated: This shows that the universal is the property of the subject in regard to the particular that is the subject.

original: de la @91b dam bcas pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par can yin te /
analyzed: de la @91b dam bcas pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par can yin te /
translated: The particular is called the â€œthesis.â€ğŸ”½For example, it is like the particular sound of a lute and the particular sound of a drum being the thesis of impermanence.

original: dper na snyan tshig gi sgra dang / rnga bo che'i sgra khyad par can mi rtag par dam bcas pa dang 'dra bar 'dir yang nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan khyad par can dag las skye ba med do zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: dper na snyan tshig gi sgra dang / rnga bo che'i sgra khyad par can mi rtag par dam bcas pa dang 'dra bar 'dir yang nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan khyad par can dag las skye ba med do zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Here, the particular that is the subject is the inner sense bases, and the thesis is â€œThey are not produced from other particular conditions.â€

original: gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa khyad par can dag rkyen ma yin par nges te zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa khyad par can dag rkyen ma yin par nges te zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: Or, the particular that is the subject is the inner sense bases such as the eyes, and the thesis is â€œThe particular that produces them is ascertained to not be a condition.â€

original: de'i don gyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: de'i don gyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni spyi yin te /
translated: â€œOne part of the meaning of thatâ€ is the universal.

original: dper na sgra spyi yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar 'dir yang gzhan spyi yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no //ğŸ”½gtan tshigs nyid du grub pa mthong bas zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la /
analyzed: dper na sgra spyi yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar 'dir yang gzhan spyi yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no // gtan tshigs nyid du grub pa mthong bas zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ces bya ba khyad par can phyogs su byas pa la /
translated: For example, it is like saying â€œbecause sound is a universal,â€ here it is taught that â€œbecause it is another universal.â€

original: spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pa de bsgrub par bya ba dang dpe gnyi ga la gtan tshigs nyid du 'grub pa mthong bas so //
analyzed: spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pa de bsgrub par bya ba dang dpe gnyi ga la gtan tshigs nyid du 'grub pa mthong bas so //
translated: â€œ Because the reason is seen to be establishedâ€ means that in the case of the statement â€œbecause it is a part of the meaning of the thesis,â€ the reason is seen to be established in both the probandum and the example.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: â€œ The reason is not ascertainedâ€ means that for the reasoners who assert arising, the reason is a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ba de ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ba de ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: For example, it is like saying â€œsound is permanent because it is sound.â€

original: 'di ltar dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu khyad par can phyogs su ma byas la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu khyad par can phyogs su ma byas la /
translated: For example, it is like the following case: â€œSound is permanent because it is sound.â€

original: spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par ma bstan pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin yang gtan tshigs su mi rung la /
analyzed: spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par ma bstan pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin yang gtan tshigs su mi rung la /
translated: Although this is one part of the meaning of the proposition, it is not suitable as a reason, because the particular is not taken as the subject and the universal is not shown to be the property of the subject.

original: dper na snyan tshig gi sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na snyan tshig gi sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, â€œThe sound of poetry is impermanent because it is sound.â€

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra yin no zhes bya ba lta bu khyad par can phyogs su byas la /
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra yin no zhes bya ba lta bu khyad par can phyogs su byas la /
translated: For example, â€œIt is the sound of a drum.â€

original: spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin yang gtan tshigs nyid du grub par mthong bas de'i phyir skye bar smra ba khyod kyi gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: spyi phyogs kyi chos yin par bstan pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin yang gtan tshigs nyid du grub par mthong bas de'i phyir skye bar smra ba khyod kyi gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Although this is one part of the meaning of the proposition, it is seen to be established as a reason, because the particular is taken as the subject and the universal is shown to be the property of the subject. Therefore, O opponent, your reason is not established and is not suitable.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gang gi tshe spyi btang ste khyad par can phyogs su byed pa de'i tshe na chos dang chos can rung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spyi btang ste khyad par can phyogs su byed pa de'i tshe na chos dang chos can rung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: When the general is stated and the specific is taken as the subject, then the subject and reason are suitable.

original: ci re zhig dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci re zhig dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, is it that the meaning of the thesis is one part of the reason,

original: dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs su mi rung bar 'gyur ram /ğŸ”½'on te snyan tshig @92a * //ğŸ”½gi sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na sgra rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de gtan tshigs su mi rung bar 'gyur ram / 'on te snyan tshig @92a * // gi sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir /
translated: like â€œSound is permanent because it is sound,â€ and thus the reason is unsuitable?ğŸ”½Or is it that the meaning of the thesis is one part of the reason, like â€œThe sound of poetry is impermanent because it is sound,â€ğŸ”½like â€œThe sound of a drum is impermanent because it is sound,â€ and thus the meaning of the thesis is seen to be established as the reason?

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya bas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs nyid du grub pa mthong ba de gnyis gang yin pa ma nges pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya bas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs nyid du grub pa mthong ba de gnyis gang yin pa ma nges pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is not ascertained which of these two is the case, your reason is unsuitable.

original: bye brag pa dag las gzhan rdul phra rab dag kho na las rdul phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs cha shas can gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub pa mngon par 'dod pa dag phyir zlog par byed de
analyzed: bye brag pa dag las gzhan rdul phra rab dag kho na las rdul phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs cha shas can gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub pa mngon par 'dod pa dag phyir zlog par byed de
translated: The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas, who assert that the gross elements earth, water, fire, and wind are produced from the aggregation of substances that have parts, such as two subtle particles and so on, are refuted.

original: / gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yon tan yin par rtog na ni rang la ma grub pa'i don nyid do //ğŸ”½de las gzhan pa'i don yin par rtog na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni mu stegs bye brag pa dag /'grel pa byed pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba de la /
analyzed: / gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yon tan yin par rtog na ni rang la ma grub pa'i don nyid do // de las gzhan pa'i don yin par rtog na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni mu stegs bye brag pa dag /'grel pa byed pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan nyid ces bya ba de la /
translated: If the meaning of the reason â€œbecause they are differentâ€ is taken to be a quality, then it is not established for you.

original: rang la ma grub pa'i don nyid dang / 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod do zhes gtan tshigs kyi skyon rjod par byed par ston to //
analyzed: rang la ma grub pa'i don nyid dang / 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod do zhes gtan tshigs kyi skyon rjod par byed par ston to //
translated: If the meaning is taken to be something other than that, then it is undermined by what is renowned in the world. This shows that the author of the commentary states that the reason â€œbecause they are differentâ€ has the fault of not being established for himself and the fault of being undermined by what is renowned in the world.

original: 'di la gal te dgag pa 'dis dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar smra ba dag ma lus par bkag pa yin na 'di ci'i phyir bye brag pa dag dgag pa dmigs kyis ston par byed ce na /ğŸ”½gang gi phyir de ltar bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa nyid brtag pa bya bas nang gi dngos po rnams de dag gi rten gzhan dag las skye ba med par bkag pa na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te dgag pa 'dis dngos po rnams gzhan las skye bar smra ba dag ma lus par bkag pa yin na 'di ci'i phyir bye brag pa dag dgag pa dmigs kyis ston par byed ce na / gang gi phyir de ltar bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa nyid brtag pa bya bas nang gi dngos po rnams de dag gi rten gzhan dag las skye ba med par bkag pa na /
translated: In this regard, if this refutation refutes all who advocate that things arise from other, why does he specifically indicate that he is refuting the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas?ğŸ”½Since the production of effects and the production of causes are to be analyzed in this way, when he refutes that internal things arise from other supports,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa kho nar bkag pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa kho nar bkag pa yin mod kyi /
translated: he also refutes that external things arise from other conditions.

original: 'on kyang mi mkhas pa kha cig 'di snyam du /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi mkhas pa kha cig 'di snyam du /
translated: However, some unwise people think as follows:

original: nang gi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba bkag gi / phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba ni ma bkag pas de'i phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yod par gyur na /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba bkag gi / phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba ni ma bkag pas de'i phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yod par gyur na /
translated: â€œHe refutes the production of internal things but does not refute the production of external things. Therefore the production of external things exists.

original: nang gi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba la yang dngos po med do snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dgag pa'i phyir dang / skye bo las dang po pa rnams kyi blo la phan gdags pa'i phyir bye brag pa dag dgag pa 'di dmigs kyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba la yang dngos po med do snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dgag pa'i phyir dang / skye bo las dang po pa rnams kyi blo la phan gdags pa'i phyir bye brag pa dag dgag pa 'di dmigs kyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: Since they think that internal things are not produced, therefore this refutation is stated in order to refute the production of external things and in order to help the minds of beginners.

original: bye brag pa dag ces bya ba ni mu stegs gzegs zan gyi slob ma mu stegs bye brag pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: bye brag pa dag ces bya ba ni mu stegs gzegs zan gyi slob ma mu stegs bye brag pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas are the tÄ«rthikas who are the students of the tÄ«rthika Kaá¹‡Äda.

original: las @92b zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: las @92b zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word â€œonlyâ€ has the meaning of restriction.

original: bye brag pa dag kho na las yin gyi gzhan las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag kho na las yin gyi gzhan las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is only the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas, not others,

original: bye brag ba dag ni blun pa nyid kyis de ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dgag pa byas kyang khong du mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag ba dag ni blun pa nyid kyis de ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dgag pa byas kyang khong du mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas, due to their stupidity, do not understand the refutation of the production of external things, even though it is done.

original: gzhan rdul phra rab dag kho na las gzhan zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag rgyu rkyen gzhan rdul phra rab kho na las 'bras bu sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs kyi cha shas can gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub pa mngon par 'dod
analyzed: gzhan rdul phra rab dag kho na las gzhan zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag rgyu rkyen gzhan rdul phra rab kho na las 'bras bu sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs kyi cha shas can gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub pa mngon par 'dod
translated: The phrase only from other subtle particles means that the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas assert that substances such as earth, water, fire, and air, which are collections of parts, are produced from other causes and conditions, namely, only from subtle particles.

original: pa'o // rdul phra rab dag ces bya ba ni rdul shin tu phra rab dag ste /
analyzed: pa'o // rdul phra rab dag ces bya ba ni rdul shin tu phra rab dag ste /
translated: The term subtle particles means extremely subtle particles.

original: gang la de'i pha rol na phra rab gzhan med pa de ni rdul phra rab dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de'i pha rol na phra rab gzhan med pa de ni rdul phra rab dag ces bya'o //
translated: That which has no other particles beyond it is called a subtle particle.

original: kho na las zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: kho na las zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The term only is also a restrictive term.

original: gzhan rdul phra rab dag kho na las yin gyi bdag las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan rdul phra rab dag kho na las yin gyi bdag las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that substances are produced only from other subtle particles and not from self.

original: de'i phyir rab tu 'jig pa chen po'i dus kyi tshes la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po'i rdul phra rab gzhan so so nas mched pa kho na dag las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu 'jig pa chen po'i dus kyi tshes la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po'i rdul phra rab gzhan so so nas mched pa kho na dag las so //
translated: Therefore, they are produced from the subtle particles of the great elements that spread out separately at the time of the great destruction of the eon and so on.

original: rdul phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs cha shas tsam gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub pa mngon par 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni bye brag pa dag las gzhan rdul phra rab dag kho na las rdul
analyzed: rdul phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs cha shas tsam gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub pa mngon par 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni bye brag pa dag las gzhan rdul phra rab dag kho na las rdul
translated: Those who assert that substances with parts such as earth, water, fire and wind are established from the gradual aggregation of two subtle particles and so on are others, that is, non Buddhists.

original: phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs cha shas can gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub par mngon par 'dod pa de dag ste /
analyzed: phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rnam grangs cha shas can gyi rdzas skye ba 'grub par mngon par 'dod pa de dag ste /
translated: Those who assert that substances with parts such as earth, water, fire and wind are established from the gradual aggregation of two subtle particles and so on are others, that is, non Buddhists.

original: de la rdul phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gzhung las 'jig rten chags pa'i dus kyi tshe dang dbang phyug gis mngon par 'dod pa dang / sems can de dag gi las yongs su smin pas des na chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dbang gis bdas pas sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de dag las dang po kho nar rdul phra rab gnyis sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de la rdul phra mo gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gzhung las 'jig rten chags pa'i dus kyi tshe dang dbang phyug gis mngon par 'dod pa dang / sems can de dag gi las yongs su smin pas des na chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dbang gis bdas pas sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de dag las dang po kho nar rdul phra rab gnyis sbyor bar byed de /
translated: First, two subtle atoms join to form a particle of two atoms.

original: de ni rdul phra mo gnyis kyi rdzas zhes bya'o //
